Tweak functor used to find flatteners/storage routines

commit_message:
ovs_neutron_agent should exit gracefully

In this patch set if any error occurs during agent initialization
phase, then it terminates ovs neutron agent gracefully.

Closes-Bug: #1351135

Co-Authored-By: Aman Kumar <amank@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Neethi Shasidhar <neethi209@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I14d091c73c8f8f4dfe70e7f9a7f7683b5fb0fd7f

commit_message:
Adding required jobs for supported datastores

Reasons:
 - it is required to have check jobs for all supported
   datastores to avoid bug omissions.

Changes:
 - adding per-datastore check job 'files' directive to enable advanced
   job execution procedure.

Change-Id: Iaaec153f2530f6671b046ea6a26307068c296b43

subject: Use Nova attachment API for attaching volume during instance scheduling
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-01-22 17:33:52.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/cfg.py', 'trove/tests/fakes/nova.py', 'trove/taskmanager/models.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/taskmanager/test_models.py'], 'message': "Use Nova attachment API for attaching volume during instance scheduling

Reasons:
 - for VMWare hypervisor nova raises exception due to invalid block device mapping
   (possible there are couple hypervisors that are also might be affected);
 - using best practices for managing volumes in OpenStack (see Heat's VolumeAttached
   resources that uses direct attach procedure);

Changes:
 - new configuration option - use_volume_attachment (type: boolean, default: True).
   This option defines how would volume be attached to an instance.
   If 'True', taskamanger will use Nova API to attach volume,
   if 'False', Taskmanager will use block device mapping instead.
 - new private function proposed: _attach_volume. It asks Nova to attach volume
   onto ACTIVE server and polls until volume would reach 'in-use' state.

Note: for safe volume mounting it is required to wait until
      server would reach ACTIVE state.

DocImpact: new configuration option was added.

Change-Id: Iffa59bbec2c031aced67b614298c804003a9e873
Closes-Bug: #1395115
"}]
commit_message:
Use Nova attachment API for attaching volume during instance scheduling

Reasons:
 - for VMWare hypervisor nova raises exception due to invalid block device mapping
   (possible there are couple hypervisors that are also might be affected);
 - using best practices for managing volumes in OpenStack (see Heat's VolumeAttached
   resources that uses direct attach procedure);

Changes:
 - new configuration option - use_volume_attachment (type: boolean, default: True).
   This option defines how would volume be attached to an instance.
   If 'True', taskamanger will use Nova API to attach volume,
   if 'False', Taskmanager will use block device mapping instead.
 - new private function proposed: _attach_volume. It asks Nova to attach volume
   onto ACTIVE server and polls until volume would reach 'in-use' state.

Note: for safe volume mounting it is required to wait until
      server would reach ACTIVE state.

DocImpact: new configuration option was added.

Change-Id: Iffa59bbec2c031aced67b614298c804003a9e873
Closes-Bug: #1395115

commit_message:
Implement MongoDB clustering integration tests

Changes:
 - added fake-mode testing
 - added integration tests

Note:
 - testing group is shared
 - example generator updated examples

HOWTO. Using trove-integration run next commands:
 1. redstack install
 2. redstack kick-start mongodb
 3. redstacl int-tests --group=mongodb_clustering

Change-Id: I164eac10160cae6fb4c46d998b7bf1ffb15417ac

commit_message:
Implement TM and Guest strategies for Cassandra datastore

Given patchset provides:
- cluster provisioning
- cluster modifications:
  - adding seed node to existing cluster;
  - adding data node to existing cluster.

TODO:
- implement recoverers for those actions that are modifying cluster state, such as:
- adding seed node (this action involves data node state modifications);
- implement workflow that allows to safe delete procedure
  for any node(independently from their type) from cluster;

Example generator(with --fix-examples)  added new updates to existing files.

Integration testing details:

commit_message:
Implement API strategy for Cassandra clustering

Given patchset implements next cases for Cassandra datastore:
1. Cluster provisioning.
2. Cluster modification through next actions:
  2.1 add_seed_node
  2.2 add_data_node

Partially Implements: blueprint cassandra-cluster

Change-Id: Ib53bd4c91c4f1b5461f1779fc2765ade6ad7d07c

commit_message:
Adding required configuration for clustering int-tests

Changes:
 - cluster size = 1
   initial_cluster_data_to_seed_nodes_ratio = 0
   token_modification_timeout = 10000
   to test small Cassandra cluster

 - num_query_routers_per_cluster = 1,
   num_config_servers_per_cluster = 1
   smallfiles = True
   for MongoDB sharded cluster for same reasons as above.

 - usage_timeout = 10000
 - agent_call_high_timeout = 300

Partially implements: blueprint cassandra-cluster

Change-Id: I28629ae218395c565ed643bd9c702453230ee22f

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-03 13:09:15.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/v1/shell.py', 'README.rst', 'troveclient/v1/clusters.py'], 'message': "Apply cluster action modifications to client library

Reasons:
 - Cassandra clustering implementation requires to submit
   'type' instance attribute as part of initial cluster
   provisioning request;
 - cluster actions execution requires client API and
    shell representation.

Changes:
 - adding client API that reflect cluster action execution
   against cluster.

Partially Implements: blueprint cassandra-cluster

Change-Id: I443f4283beca452ad17e4907399a1d2f45b5f1d4

commit_message:
Apply cluster action modifications to client library

Reasons:
 - Cassandra clustering implementation requires to submit
   'type' instance attribute as part of initial cluster
   provisioning request;
 - cluster actions execution requires client API and
    shell representation.

Changes:
 - adding client API that reflect cluster action execution
   against cluster.

Partially Implements: blueprint cassandra-cluster

Change-Id: I443f4283beca452ad17e4907399a1d2f45b5f1d4

subject: Fix Redis Ubuntu elements for Ubuntu Trusty Tahr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-11 17:36:05.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/redstack', 'scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-redis/install.d/10-redis'], 'message': 'Fix Redis Ubuntu elements for Ubuntu Trusty Tahr

Reasons:
 - image elements are trying to add a duplicate
   of Ubuntu Tahr source repository;
 - due to specific configuration of repository that comes
   from image element Redis installation is failing
   due to unmet dependencies

Changes:
 - adding proper fix to 10-redis element
 - fixing redstack script with appropriate Redis version

Change-Id: Iddfa2d90a05498e59642ff2f856f19551e9883e7
Closes-Bug: #1391590
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Redis Ubuntu elements for Ubuntu Trusty Tahr

Reasons:
 - image elements are trying to add a duplicate
   of Ubuntu Tahr source repository;
 - due to specific configuration of repository that comes
   from image element Redis installation is failing
   due to unmet dependencies

Changes:
 - adding proper fix to 10-redis element
 - fixing redstack script with appropriate Redis version

Change-Id: Iddfa2d90a05498e59642ff2f856f19551e9883e7
Closes-Bug: #1391590

commit_message:
Fix PostgreSQL elements to work properly on Ubuntu Trusty Tahr

Reasons:
 - Ubuntu Trusty Tahr doesn't have postgresql-9.1 package,
   recent version for Trusty - 9.3.

Changes:
 - fixing ubuntu image elements for PostgreSQL
 - fixing PostgreSQL version in redstack script

Change-Id: I667990a668bb23c422a7bb8ed914cce02fb5324a
Closes-Bug: #1391585

commit_message:
Fix incremental backups feature validation

Reasons:
 - Not all strategies have incremental backup strategy.
   Existing example: MySQLDump.
   Future: CbBackup, MongoDump, NodetoolSnapshot.

Changes:
 - incremental backups feature validation stage added;
 - refactoring validate_can_perform_action method of Backup class
 - adding fix to fake guest to prevent fake-mode tests failure;
 - unit tests proposed.

Behaviour:
 - server side will raise DatastoreOptionNotSupported,
   it fits perfectly to existing implementation;
 - from client perspective this error will interpreted
   as HTTP NotImplemented(501).

Change-Id: Ib6140f16be44a79c4bbad1a368b33d76ac3e873a
Closes-Bug: #1340175

commit_message:
Add datastore and version validation step for replica provisioning

Reasons:
 - Since slave is being provisioned by POST
   against /instances/ Trove should validate
   that replica datastore and version matching
   root replica's source datastore and version.

Changes:
 - validation added;
 - int/unit tests were proposed.
 - minor fixes of example generator
 - updates API samples
 - doc note about running API example generator

Change-Id: I3dace3e514a3f767805a49d49a11c443b7510659
Closes-Bug: #1357709

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-01-29 14:10:50.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/cassandra/manager.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/cassandra/system.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/cassandra/service.py'], 'message': 'Fix Cassandra service status definition

Reasons:
 - At slow environment (small flavors, etc.),
   for certain reasons Cassandra instances hitting SHUTDOWN state
   for short period of time. This issue breaks assertion
   in int-test that waits for guest to reach ACTIVE state.
 - periodic task was trying to define instance status
   before Cassandra was up and ready.

Changes:
 - extending service status definition mechanism
   for _get_actual_db_status
   (verifies that all transport services
   are up and ready, if they were enabled);

Change-Id: If50c1a2fd8778e2472a1266817a42d5c3c73d8b6
Closes-Bug: #1314980
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Cassandra service status definition

Reasons:
 - At slow environment (small flavors, etc.),
   for certain reasons Cassandra instances hitting SHUTDOWN state
   for short period of time. This issue breaks assertion
   in int-test that waits for guest to reach ACTIVE state.
 - periodic task was trying to define instance status
   before Cassandra was up and ready.

Changes:
 - extending service status definition mechanism
   for _get_actual_db_status
   (verifies that all transport services
   are up and ready, if they were enabled);

Change-Id: If50c1a2fd8778e2472a1266817a42d5c3c73d8b6
Closes-Bug: #1314980

subject: EC: Multi-phase commit conversation for PUTs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7485, 'name': 'Tushar Gohad', 'email': 'tushar.gohad@intel.com', 'username': 'tsg'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-03-03 01:20:21.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/common/test_storage_policy.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/obj/mem_diskfile.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py', 'swift/common/swob.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'swift/common/exceptions.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'EC: Multi-phase commit conversation for PUTs

For erasure-coded PUTs, object servers have a requirement to keep
the previous version of .data file for an object around, in case
the most recent PUT for that object (in case of object-overwrite,
for instance) didn't complete successfully on a quorum of nodes.
The reconstructor eventually will clean up the old .data files
after confirming a successful PUT.

The object server/reconstructor needs a mechanism to tell if a set
of EC fragment archives constitute a successful/durable PUT for an
object.  Multi-phase commit conversation as implemented by this
patch is a solution.  Basic flow looks like:

 * proxy server erasure codes and streams the object fragments to
   (ec_ndata + ec_nparity) object servers
 * object servers store objects as EC archives and upon finishing
   object data/metadata write, send a 1st-phase response to proxy
 * upon quorum of object server responses, the proxy initiates
   2nd-phase by sending "commit" confirmations to object servers
 * upon receipt of commit message, object servers store a 0-byte
   data file as '<timestamp>.durable' indicating successful PUT,
   and send a final response to the proxy server
 * proxy waits for a minimal number (2) of object servers to
   respond with a success (2xx) status before responding to the
   client with a successful status

The multi-phase conversation is implemented via MIME documents
which provides us the ability to keep within the WSGI semantics
and handle both phases of PUT in a single HTTP transaction.  We
use 100-continue responses as a machanism to signal the end of
phase1/successful object data/metadata write to the proxy server.

Example conversation on the wire:

  proxy: PUT /p/a/c/o
         Transfer-Encoding': 'chunked'
         Expect': '100-continue'
         X-Backend-Obj-Multiphase-Commit: yes

  obj:   100 Continue
         X-Obj-Multiphase-Commit: yes

  proxy: --MIMEboundary
         X-Document: object body

         <obj_data>

         --MIMEboundary
         X-Document: object metadata
         Content-MD5: <footer_meta_cksum>

         <footer_meta>

         --MIMEboundary

  <object server writes data, metadata>

  obj:   100 Continue

  <quorum>

  proxy: X-Document: put commit

         commit_confirmation

         --MIMEboundary--

  <object server writes ts.durable state>

  obj:   20x

  <proxy waits to receive >=2 2xx responses>

  proxy: 2xx -> client

Note: This patch extends DiskFile and DiskFileWriter APIs for
.durable state file manipulation.  New functions:
  DiskFileWriter::write_durable_timestamp(timestamp)
  DiskFile::is_durable()

UpgradeImpact
Implements: blueprint ec-proxy-work
Change-Id: Id05593b4fa7a393d62a96f8c1627383a8e0b0340
'}]
commit_message:
EC: Multi-phase commit conversation for PUTs

For erasure-coded PUTs, object servers have a requirement to keep
the previous version of .data file for an object around, in case
the most recent PUT for that object (in case of object-overwrite,
for instance) didn't complete successfully on a quorum of nodes.
The reconstructor eventually will clean up the old .data files
after confirming a successful PUT.

The object server/reconstructor needs a mechanism to tell if a set
of EC fragment archives constitute a successful/durable PUT for an
object.  Multi-phase commit conversation as implemented by this
patch is a solution.  Basic flow looks like:

 * proxy server erasure codes and streams the object fragments to
   (ec_ndata + ec_nparity) object servers
 * object servers store objects as EC archives and upon finishing
   object data/metadata write, send a 1st-phase response to proxy
 * upon quorum of object server responses, the proxy initiates
   2nd-phase by sending "commit" confirmations to object servers
 * upon receipt of commit message, object servers store a 0-byte
   data file as '<timestamp>.durable' indicating successful PUT,
   and send a final response to the proxy server
 * proxy waits for a minimal number (2) of object servers to
   respond with a success (2xx) status before responding to the
   client with a successful status

The multi-phase conversation is implemented via MIME documents
which provides us the ability to keep within the WSGI semantics
and handle both phases of PUT in a single HTTP transaction.  We
use 100-continue responses as a machanism to signal the end of
phase1/successful object data/metadata write to the proxy server.

Example conversation on the wire:

  proxy: PUT /p/a/c/o
         Transfer-Encoding': 'chunked'
         Expect': '100-continue'
         X-Backend-Obj-Multiphase-Commit: yes

  obj:   100 Continue
         X-Obj-Multiphase-Commit: yes

  proxy: --MIMEboundary
         X-Document: object body

         <obj_data>

         --MIMEboundary
         X-Document: object metadata
         Content-MD5: <footer_meta_cksum>

         <footer_meta>

         --MIMEboundary

  <object server writes data, metadata>

  obj:   100 Continue

  <quorum>

  proxy: X-Document: put commit

         commit_confirmation

         --MIMEboundary--

  <object server writes ts.durable state>

  obj:   20x

  <proxy waits to receive >=2 2xx responses>

  proxy: 2xx -> client

Note: This patch extends DiskFile and DiskFileWriter APIs for
.durable state file manipulation.  New functions:
  DiskFileWriter::write_durable_timestamp(timestamp)
  DiskFile::is_durable()

UpgradeImpact
Implements: blueprint ec-proxy-work
Change-Id: Id05593b4fa7a393d62a96f8c1627383a8e0b0340

commit_message:
Support full backup/restore for Cassandra

Reasons:
 - backup/restore are significant
   features for database management;

Changes:
 - adding required configurations for resolving
   backup/restore strategy and its namespaces;
 - adding backup/restore implementations;
 - updating discovery mechanism;
 - adding oslo-group attribute to distinct
   backup implementations, to keep code
   clean and improve readabilitily;
 - unit/int tests proposed.

DocImpact: added configuration options backup/restore namespaces and
           backup_strategy for Cassandra datastore.

Implements: blueprint cassandra-backup-restore

Change-Id: I6da2cf726bdb4ab2b969b745f32429e3b2c98bdb

commit_message:
Fixed links in multi-server Swift documentation

The link to the ubuntu installation guide was incorrect and 404'ing.

This change updates page to point (anchor) to the install guide
section of docs.openstack.org, so it will always point to the latest
versions of the install documentation.

It also updates the deep links to the current install guides for the
past few releases.

As links continue to get outdated or we forget to add new ones, the
anchor link at the top of the page will probably still work.

Change-Id: I38299c03370936eb41992a953aa9d10b01a8396b
Closes-Bug: #1147331

commit_message:
Provide more contextual information about invalid periodics

Instead of just telling the user of the periodic worker that
certain callbacks were invalid tell the user which callback
was invalid and exactly what attributes were expected but were
not found. This makes the errors that much easier to diagnose
and to resolve.

Change-Id: Iaf8caf5e460e3ff4731ef575e924c9b86a9d5ae1

subject: Fix lookup scoping multi-match ordering
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-25 06:34:27.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_engines.py', 'taskflow/tests/utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/worker_based/test_worker.py', 'taskflow/utils/misc.py'], 'message': 'Fix lookup scoping multi-match ordering

When look-up is occurring the possible provider
ordering is used instead of the scope returned provider
ordering. This causes incorrect matches when look-up
argument names that are produced by multiple providers (at
the same scope level) all providing the same requirement
name.

The scope order should be enforced as the de-facto order
and not the order that the storage unit finds (which is
hash based and varies depending on hash ordering).

Closes-Bug: #1425326

Change-Id: I15f1ee5515758bdc470c0f7dd7a2f616923e5628
'}]
commit_message:
Fix lookup scoping multi-match ordering

When look-up is occurring the possible provider
ordering is used instead of the scope returned provider
ordering. This causes incorrect matches when look-up
argument names that are produced by multiple providers (at
the same scope level) all providing the same requirement
name.

The scope order should be enforced as the de-facto order
and not the order that the storage unit finds (which is
hash based and varies depending on hash ordering).

Closes-Bug: #1425326

Change-Id: I15f1ee5515758bdc470c0f7dd7a2f616923e5628

subject: Property exception message doesn't has resource name prefix
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-26 05:53:26.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_properties.py', 'heat/engine/properties.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Property exception message doesn't has resource name prefix

When an unknown property is provided in the heat template,
heat raise an exception as below:

Unknown Property <prp-name>

To avoid the confusion if a template has multiple resources
with same named property, its fixed to report as below

Unknown Property <resource name>: <prp-name>

Change-Id: Id5eb557da9784ec0429bf1c5b246556dd92dfd6b
Closes-bug: #1425795
"}]
commit_message:
Property exception message doesn't has resource name prefix

When an unknown property is provided in the heat template,
heat raise an exception as below:

Unknown Property <prp-name>

To avoid the confusion if a template has multiple resources
with same named property, its fixed to report as below

Unknown Property <resource name>: <prp-name>

Change-Id: Id5eb557da9784ec0429bf1c5b246556dd92dfd6b
Closes-bug: #1425795

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-31 03:41:02.000000000', 'files': ['.pylintrc', 'neutron/pylint/oslologcheck.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/pylint/test_oslologcheck.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add a custom pylint check for oslo i18n and logging

This change adds a new pylint test capable of detecting numerous
violations of OpenStack i18n policies:

- Incorrectly marked severities:
    LOG.info(_LE('error or info?'))
- Logging that is not marked for translation:
    LOG.info('untranslated')
- Over-eager interpolation:
    LOG.info(_LI('foo: %s') % 'bar')
- Concatenating translated literals:
    _('foo') + 'bar'
- Using more than one positional argument in a translated message:
    _('Found %s in %s')
- Using translation marker on something other than a string literal:
    msg = 'Error'; _(msg)
- Performs existing pylint format checks on OpenStack logging calls:
    LOG.info(_('%(a)s but %(b)s is missing', {'a': 'foo'}))
- Logging messages not marked with explicit severity:
    LOG.info(_('foo'))

(This change disables the last one mentioned above as the migration to
_LI/_LE/etc is far from complete.  If anyone wants to check their
portion of the codebase, they can experiment with enabling
log-i18n-default)

A significant feature of this check over the existing pep8/hackng checks
is that in many cases it is also able to trace values through
intermediate lines of code.  In particular, it can handle many variants
of this common OpenStack idiom:

    msg = _('failed')
    logging.info(msg)
    raise msg

Change-Id: I319632204663f3e5640133145dd0cd60733c6c11
"}]
commit_message:
Add a custom pylint check for oslo i18n and logging

This change adds a new pylint test capable of detecting numerous
violations of OpenStack i18n policies:

- Incorrectly marked severities:
    LOG.info(_LE('error or info?'))
- Logging that is not marked for translation:
    LOG.info('untranslated')
- Over-eager interpolation:
    LOG.info(_LI('foo: %s') % 'bar')
- Concatenating translated literals:
    _('foo') + 'bar'
- Using more than one positional argument in a translated message:
    _('Found %s in %s')
- Using translation marker on something other than a string literal:
    msg = 'Error'; _(msg)
- Performs existing pylint format checks on OpenStack logging calls:
    LOG.info(_('%(a)s but %(b)s is missing', {'a': 'foo'}))
- Logging messages not marked with explicit severity:
    LOG.info(_('foo'))

(This change disables the last one mentioned above as the migration to
_LI/_LE/etc is far from complete.  If anyone wants to check their
portion of the codebase, they can experiment with enabling
log-i18n-default)

A significant feature of this check over the existing pep8/hackng checks
is that in many cases it is also able to trace values through
intermediate lines of code.  In particular, it can handle many variants
of this common OpenStack idiom:

    msg = _('failed')
    logging.info(msg)
    raise msg

Change-Id: I319632204663f3e5640133145dd0cd60733c6c11

This test contained an invalid filter, which was
simply being ignored by both driver and
controller.

This patch fixes this bug and add a test to show

commit_message:
Limit WorkflowExecution.state_info size.

This fixes a bug when workflow execution fails due to large output,
and failure handler can't update DB because state_info field is
too big. Good against DOS attacks, too.

Change-Id: I37103bac445dbcef49c6bfe6869a9ebd6938c86d

The DB migration often needs to clone a table into a new one as
databases like sqlite do not support most of the ALTER commands for
in-place modification of table schema. This utility has method to clone
a table to new one so that a new table can be created and data migrated
to it for handling migration. This is fairly generic, therefore new file

New generic functions can be added here when needed.

commit_message:
Utility for database migration.

The DB migration often needs to clone a table into a new one as
databases like sqlite do not support most of the ALTER commands for
in-place modification of table schema. This utility has method to clone
a table to new one so that a new table can be created and data migrated
to it for handling migration. This is fairly generic, therefore new file
is added.

New generic functions can be added here when needed.

Co-Authored-By: Visnusaran Murugan <visnusaran.murugan@hp.com>

Change-Id: I229907dc2cab618ca5c76a72956ce8c5f49a2127

commit_message:
Move software service logic to own module

The size of EngineService is starting to affect maintainability.
This change creates service_software_config.SoftwareConfigService
and moves all the software config service method implementations
into it.

Software config calls to EngineService are delegated to
SoftwareConfigService. Unit tests remain in test_engine_service to
include the EngineService entrypoint methods in the test coverage.

Change-Id: Icf51dfd35423ac33a9126731862a90525c17306c
Related-Blueprint: software-config-trigger

subject: Patch validate methods with mock instead of mox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-02 15:00:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/common.py', 'heat/tests/test_autoscaling_update_policy.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_group_update_policy.py'], 'message': "Patch validate methods with mock instead of mox

There are huge numbers of tests where we patch validate methods for
constraints. Currently we use for it mox, but it requires us to add
ReplayAll and VerifyAll in tests, where we use mock. So let's teach it
to use mock, it should make easier migration on mock in the future.

Change-Id: Ia82b3507b8699ffa0db20bd3c24279263ff9cc4b
"}]
commit_message:
Patch validate methods with mock instead of mox

There are huge numbers of tests where we patch validate methods for
constraints. Currently we use for it mox, but it requires us to add
ReplayAll and VerifyAll in tests, where we use mock. So let's teach it
to use mock, it should make easier migration on mock in the future.

Change-Id: Ia82b3507b8699ffa0db20bd3c24279263ff9cc4b

commit_message:
Cinder objects base

This patch is to insert the objects code base, currently based
on nova.objects.  It will be later based on
oslo_versionedobjects once it is available.  This is done
to make progress on changing cinder internals to use objects,
since nova.objects and oslo.versionedobjects are similar.

Inserted objects code base into cinder and modified cinder services
to use object-aware serializer.

Change-Id: I42a6cc43da19ca29db4cfb33cbf794afed18f758
Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

subject: Rename "Keystone LightWeight Tokens" (KLWT) to "Fernet" tokens
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 8978, 'name': 'Marek Denis', 'email': 'marek.denis+openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'marek-denis'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13055, 'name': 'Alexander Makarov', 'email': 'ajiekcahdp.makapob@gmail.com', 'username': 'amakarov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-02 23:54:40.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/provider.py', 'keystone/common/config.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'keystone/token/providers/fernet/__init__.py', 'keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py', 'keystone/token/providers/fernet/core.py', 'keystone/exception.py', 'keystone/token/providers/fernet/utils.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py', 'keystone/cli.py'], 'message': 'Rename "Keystone LightWeight Tokens" (KLWT) to "Fernet" tokens

Reasoning:

- We generally name tokens after the technology used in their transport
  format. For example, we also don't refer to UUID tokens as "UUID4
  tokens" nor PKI tokens as "JSON tokens", both of which would describe
  their payload. We also don't refer to PKI tokens as "Keystone
  HeavyWeight Tokens (KHWT)" because that would be arbitrary and
  redundant. And besides, UUID tokens are smaller ("lighter") than KLWT
  tokens anyway.

- The payload in KLWT tokens (read: Automated Teller Machine machine) is
  a MessagePacked tuple. Referring to these tokens as either
  "MessagePacked tokens" or "tuple tokens" does nothing to describe the
  end user's experience with them, and would oddly preclude other tokens
  from using the same underlying technologies. There's no reason that
  a future version of PKI tokens couldn't carry a MessagePacked payload.

- Fernet is actually a well defined specification intended for use as
  API tokens: https://github.com/fernet/spec

Change-Id: I6d7aca0ef23df6932544f5dcf6eb1fac0af012ae
'}]
commit_message:
Rename "Keystone LightWeight Tokens" (KLWT) to "Fernet" tokens

Reasoning:

- We generally name tokens after the technology used in their transport
  format. For example, we also don't refer to UUID tokens as "UUID4
  tokens" nor PKI tokens as "JSON tokens", both of which would describe
  their payload. We also don't refer to PKI tokens as "Keystone
  HeavyWeight Tokens (KHWT)" because that would be arbitrary and
  redundant. And besides, UUID tokens are smaller ("lighter") than KLWT
  tokens anyway.

- The payload in KLWT tokens (read: Automated Teller Machine machine) is
  a MessagePacked tuple. Referring to these tokens as either
  "MessagePacked tokens" or "tuple tokens" does nothing to describe the
  end user's experience with them, and would oddly preclude other tokens
  from using the same underlying technologies. There's no reason that
  a future version of PKI tokens couldn't carry a MessagePacked payload.

- Fernet is actually a well defined specification intended for use as
  API tokens: https://github.com/fernet/spec

Change-Id: I6d7aca0ef23df6932544f5dcf6eb1fac0af012ae

commit_message:
Use mock instead of fixtures when appropriate

This patch chnages code that uses fixtures.MonkeyPatch to use mock
where possible. Also tempfile is used instead of fixtures.TempFile in
one place.

Change-Id: I739d59b8dc34e87649852d08fed7ff955b230363

commit_message:
Keystone Lightweight Tokens (KLWT)

This includes a KLW token provider and keystone-manage commands to
initialize a key repository and perform key rotation.

Co-Authored-By: Dolph Mathews <dolph.mathews@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ibca4b1765d06f239df113aa3ec367e60de61a225
Implements: bp klw-tokens

Get, create, and delete snapshot APIs were changed to
use new snapshot objects.  A skeleton volume object was

commit_message:
Snapshot and volume objects

Abstract volumes and volume snapshots into objects.
Get, create, and delete snapshot APIs were changed to
use new snapshot objects.  A skeleton volume object was
created, but cinder internals were not changed to use
the volume object, although volume is referenced and
used by the snapshot object.  The internals will be
changed to use volume object in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I387018e80c8539565e99454db65d976030002c0f
Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

subject: Add gabbi tests to cover the SamplesController
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-02 16:52:32.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/gabbi/gabbits/samples.yaml'], 'message': 'Add gabbi tests to cover the SamplesController

The samples controller has only two methods, get_all and get_one. This
new yaml file makes simple queries against a suite of three samples
provided by the SampleDataFixture to validate expected behavior.

Four xfails were required to account for limitations in the framework
that supports the SampleController. Bugs have been linked from the
yaml file.

Change-Id: Ifa90d43cb43bf79c850b4d604d1ddb67a5e06d56
'}]
commit_message:
Add gabbi tests to cover the SamplesController

The samples controller has only two methods, get_all and get_one. This
new yaml file makes simple queries against a suite of three samples
provided by the SampleDataFixture to validate expected behavior.

Four xfails were required to account for limitations in the framework
that supports the SampleController. Bugs have been linked from the
yaml file.

Change-Id: Ifa90d43cb43bf79c850b4d604d1ddb67a5e06d56

commit_message:
Generic changes for Node Inspection

1. Adds two new fields to table ``nodes``.
2. Enable changes in conductor and api to execute
   the methods for inspection.
3. Adds the default timeout `inspect_timeout` in
   ironic.conf.sample file.
The new field 'last_inspected' has been renamed to
'inspection_finished_at' after discussion.

The ironic-client changes for 'inspect' to be
added to the list of node-set-provision-state valid
actions are being addressed by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148804

Implements : blueprint ironic-node-properties-discovery

DocImpact

Change-Id: If9aab90accf5a60ad3febbfc1f5d367eed987c13

commit_message:
Keystone REST API single project GET

The URL regex was not including the ID capture, so actually calling
the URL via angular didn't work. This adds the ID capture.

You can manually verify it by going to with POSTMAN:

http://localhost:9000/api/keystone/projects/9e789090449f45f3aaf15823f7e2da1a

See also: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/RESTAPI

Partially Implements: blueprint instance-details-redesign

Change-Id: I83a8312e772422d96f3c7a15816c45a700e2d047

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 6610, 'name': 'Zhenguo Niu', 'email': 'Niu.ZGlinux@gmail.com', 'username': 'niu-zglinux'}, {'_account_id': 9576, 'name': 'Thai Tran', 'email': 'tqtran@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'tqtran'}, {'_account_id': 11303, 'name': 'Markus Zoeller (markus_z)', 'email': 'mzoeller@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'mzoeller'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-02 21:42:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/views.py'], 'message': 'context['view'] not available in Serial Console

In some configurations, the Serial Console gives
a "cannot find instance" error even though the
instance is available for the given id.

See project/instances/views.py SerialConsoleView.
The problem is that it is using context['view'].request
and throwing an exception because in some configurations
context['view'] is not found. Not clear on why it is
there in some cases, e.g. in devstack dev environment.

In any event, the right way to code it is to use
self instead of context['view']. This is what
other classes do in views.py. I confirmed that
self == context['view'].

Closes-bug: #1427391

Change-Id: Ib97f874695c874eb97a5aeb6f84661e33a427477'}]
commit_message:
context['view'] not available in Serial Console

In some configurations, the Serial Console gives
a "cannot find instance" error even though the
instance is available for the given id.

See project/instances/views.py SerialConsoleView.
The problem is that it is using context['view'].request
and throwing an exception because in some configurations
context['view'] is not found. Not clear on why it is
there in some cases, e.g. in devstack dev environment.

In any event, the right way to code it is to use
self instead of context['view']. This is what
other classes do in views.py. I confirmed that
self == context['view'].

Closes-bug: #1427391

Change-Id: Ib97f874695c874eb97a5aeb6f84661e33a427477

subject: Remove spaces from extension lists
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-03 00:03:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Remove spaces from extension lists

This commit removes all of the spaces from the extension lists in the
env vars for passed into iniset. With spaces these lists are only getting
the first item set in the output tempest.conf file which means we only run
a very small subset of the tests we intend to.

Change-Id: I489f6ec4dd5b1824ebff576902746b160c6b8bc5
'}]
commit_message:
Remove spaces from extension lists

This commit removes all of the spaces from the extension lists in the
env vars for passed into iniset. With spaces these lists are only getting
the first item set in the output tempest.conf file which means we only run
a very small subset of the tests we intend to.

Change-Id: I489f6ec4dd5b1824ebff576902746b160c6b8bc5

commit_message:
Add python-keyczar to global-requirements.py

In Keystone, we're using python-keyczar to manage keys for an authenticated
encryption token solution. The library is Apache 2.0 licensed. The project
homepage can be found at https://code.google.com/p/keyczar/

Change-Id: Ibd951bf2a288bc1939495efda7e47778a2e96317

subject: Bump oslo.log for critical nova regression
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-02 17:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump oslo.log for critical nova regression

Once Nova switched over to oslo.log, we realized that "instance"
objects were printed wrong in the nova logs. Essentially instead
of just the uuid, the entire __repr__ of the instance object was
printed in the logs, making them unreadable. This was fixed in
I2d1b09015bead2012327f973f45f3f6728160c69 and oslo.log 0.4.0
was released.

Related-Bug: #1426544
Change-Id: I982b165ed64494a14dcd6b2e78d3f43a3f75aa53
'}]
commit_message:
Bump oslo.log for critical nova regression

Once Nova switched over to oslo.log, we realized that "instance"
objects were printed wrong in the nova logs. Essentially instead
of just the uuid, the entire __repr__ of the instance object was
printed in the logs, making them unreadable. This was fixed in
I2d1b09015bead2012327f973f45f3f6728160c69 and oslo.log 0.4.0
was released.

Related-Bug: #1426544
Change-Id: I982b165ed64494a14dcd6b2e78d3f43a3f75aa53

commit_message:
Refactor and provide scaffolding for domain specific loading

In preparation for the support of loading domain specific
configuration options from a database backend, the existing
code structure for loading from files is refactored to make
this easier. In addition the config option to support
domain specific configurations loading from a database is
also added (which will result in a NotImplemented error if
it is enabled).

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-config-ext

Change-Id: Iaa7b11e3b719bd68635e7b8a5b7217993db41b1b

commit_message:
Tidy up clean-samples.yaml

Improve the readability and use of gabbi to be more in line with
what we've learned since this file was created. The primary changes
are:

* more liberal use of comments and white space for better
  readability
* JSON in the data section
* xfail with link to bugs when there are issues with the HTTP
  handling

The xfail in this case is that when a sample is POSTed there is no
location header in the response.

Change-Id: I6520ea133b3feb9a764b41ecf47bebcc33ca7cb4

commit_message:
Adding policy rest endpoint for angular

Providing an endpoint for angular code to make policy checks
on the horizon server. There currently is no clientside cache
of the calls, that will be a follow-on work.

Implements blueprint: policy-for-angular
Change-Id: Ieacbc502440c2e3a2e32ec6bcaa002310e82a681

commit_message:
Refactor of Metadata Widget

First step of making metadata widget logic reusable.

See dependent patches. It was hard to see the changes
in Gerrit when doing the renaming and refactoring at
once. Gerrit didn't seem to understand that it was
a rename, making the review more difficult to view.

Partial-Bug: 1394472
Change-Id: I01eac21bf78b4b5545405e1ae4cb9a11619e8bc6

commit_message:
Generate a drop down field for custom heat parameters

If the heat template parameter has a custom constraint of
'nova.flavor', 'nova.keypair', 'glance.image' or 'neutron.network',
the form will generate a drop down field with a list of all
possible options the current user has access to.

Change-Id: I17f99eca364f1123a950cf712225ce751728239e
blueprint: heat-template-choices
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Soulas <cedric.soulas@cloudwatt.com>

Refactor Gerrit plugin build jobs

job a little more generic so that users can reuse it to build other
gerrit plugins.

commit_message:
Limit target projects for the neutron func job

The neutron functional job does not rely on repositories other than
devstack and neutron, so limit the projects that devstack-gate updates
in the workspace accordingly.

This change also reverts the changes to the neutron api job that
validated that the functional job could safely run with a restricted
set of projects.

Change-Id: Ic59c3b2cc5d0b40a8f05c2d89eb1cf5e9e2f0d1d

commit_message:
Limit manual jobs

Limit the jobs for the OpenStack manuals:
* Run checklinks only if xml files are changed.
* Run checksyntax only if xml, po, or pot files are changed.

subject: Handle resize/migrate with config drivers on rbd
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2033, 'name': 'Belmiro Moreira', 'email': 'moreira.belmiro.email.lists@gmail.com', 'username': 'moreira-belmiro-email-lists'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6984, 'name': 'Sébastien Han', 'email': 'seb@redhat.com', 'username': 'leseb'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14358, 'name': 'Marian Horban', 'email': 'm.horban@gmail.com', 'username': 'mhorban'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 11:37:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Handle resize/migrate with config drivers on rbd

Since we store the config drive on rbd, the resize and migrate
of an instance should work, but the import of the config driver
is uncondionnal done even the config driver is already imported in
rbd.

This change fixes that by checking the existance of the config drive
before trying to re-upload it.

Related-bug: #1369627
Related-bug: #1361840
Fixes-bug: #1246201

Change-Id: I0da201f8719abbea20cf243ce38d012e80586096
'}]
commit_message:
Handle resize/migrate with config drivers on rbd

Since we store the config drive on rbd, the resize and migrate
of an instance should work, but the import of the config driver
is uncondionnal done even the config driver is already imported in
rbd.

This change fixes that by checking the existance of the config drive
before trying to re-upload it.

Related-bug: #1369627
Related-bug: #1361840
Fixes-bug: #1246201

Change-Id: I0da201f8719abbea20cf243ce38d012e80586096

subject: Remove explicit thread-local update in context
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-28 13:41:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack-common.conf', 'designate/context.py', 'designate/openstack/common/local.py'], 'message': "Remove explicit thread-local update in context

oslo.context now handles this internally, so we can remove the
duplication. Additionally - This is the last explicit use of
oslo-incubator's local module, so we remove it and it's
reference in openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I649b1873f69a37c9acb5b13d6ae750782ed7776c
"}]
commit_message:
Remove explicit thread-local update in context

oslo.context now handles this internally, so we can remove the
duplication. Additionally - This is the last explicit use of
oslo-incubator's local module, so we remove it and it's
reference in openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I649b1873f69a37c9acb5b13d6ae750782ed7776c

commit_message:
Explicitly add noproxy for congress host for curl

Curl seems to have issue with no_proxy for sub net, e.g.
10.2.2.1/16. So explicitly specifying noproxy for congress
host could avoid this kind of issue.

Change-Id: Ic957ff7ab5cd2f6d383ab56c2b165589b2d9fad1

commit_message:
Get initiator from manager and send to controller

Using the WSGI context that is available at the manager layer,
we can get the Initiator content we need and forward it to the manager
classes.

Co-Authored-By: Morgan Fainberg <morgan.fainberg@gmail.com>
partially implements bp: cadf-everywhere

Change-Id: I6b7885d29cd733c5040bea6003dd93607cb5821e

Implements: blueprint swift-enc-proxy
'}]
commit_message:
Implement encryption proxy middleware for server-side-encryption.

Design information on
  https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Swift/server-side-enc

Uses a static key manager and PyCrypto. Encryption with AES in
various chaning modes including CBC mode. The encryption format will
permit range reads.

Change-Id: I734f22ca8cf29b33eaaeebf581c146f0a73a38ea
Implements: blueprint swift-enc-proxy

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-03-02 18:24:23.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/notifications.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/common/test_notifications.py'], 'message': 'Add in non-decorator notifiers

Add non-decorator based notifiers in. These notifiers will be used
in lieu of the decorator based notifiers so that the initiator can
be passed through to the manager for notification that does not
result in suboptimal design patterns where an argument is passed to
the manager for the sole purpose of the decorator inspecting for it
to populate data in the CADF notifications.

Change-Id: I684cf11325ffa7e6320088bd8b8ebb6cda29ad12
'}]
commit_message:
Add in non-decorator notifiers

Add non-decorator based notifiers in. These notifiers will be used
in lieu of the decorator based notifiers so that the initiator can
be passed through to the manager for notification that does not
result in suboptimal design patterns where an argument is passed to
the manager for the sole purpose of the decorator inspecting for it
to populate data in the CADF notifications.

partially implements bp: cadf-everywhere

Change-Id: I684cf11325ffa7e6320088bd8b8ebb6cda29ad12

subject: Hyper-V: Skips already performed actions
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-17 13:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/utilsv2.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/test_utilsv2.py'], 'message': 'Hyper-V: Skips already performed actions

Adds a check in order to avoid reconnecting vswitch
ports if they are already connected.

Adds a check in order to avoid readding the VLAN
setting data if it already exists and is properly set.

Closes-Bug: #1422439

Change-Id: I3ae4d7de419a52470789d54f2dacea1f38f3a599
'}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: Skips already performed actions

Adds a check in order to avoid reconnecting vswitch
ports if they are already connected.

Adds a check in order to avoid readding the VLAN
setting data if it already exists and is properly set.

Closes-Bug: #1422439

Change-Id: I3ae4d7de419a52470789d54f2dacea1f38f3a599

commit_message:
Removes unused argument from disconnect_switch_port

The method 'disconnect_switch_port' in the classes
HyperVUtils and HyperVUtilsV2 does not use the given
'vswitch_name' argument, so there is no point in
having it at all.

Change-Id: I8d02be172e3951e1eefc2354c819a47fbbf3928c

commit_message:
Add requirement for APIImpact flag

Adds a requirement for an APIImpact flag in
the commit message for a proposed spec if it proposes
changes to the Swift REST API. This will make it
much easier for people such as the API WG who want to
review API changes across OpenStack to find and
review proposed API changes.

Change-Id: I3cadb5e26423a5c493ac2d98b84760980dc24183

commit_message:
Draft specification for storage encryption in Swift

This draft serves for agreeing on the security goals of encryption
support in Swift, its design and important implementation choices.

This spec is based on the "spec for on-disk encryption" here
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123220/
and extends the security model and the design. It also takes
into account some of the discussion there.

For relevant background, see also the earlier blueprint
  https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/swift-enc-proxy

Change-Id: Ib683db83252e649328e7d4790e87524430132db8

commit_message:
Don't call schedule_routers for a remove_router_interface

Calling schedule_routers when doing a remove_router_interface
can cause significant performance problems in scaled environments.
This is due to check_ports_exist_on_l3agent unnecessarily looping
through large numbers of ports for every l3 agent.

Change-Id: I64f23e344c72ba78a617bb5f682d2e2bfeceac55
Closes-Bug: #1420032

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-27 22:10:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Clear migration_status from a destination volume if migration fails

When some error happens during volume migration, cinder-volume
keeps remaining a destination volume because the volume copy may be
in the completing phase and a source volume may be deleted already.

In this case, the migration_status of the destination volume in
data base should be cleared. As a result, the volume can be handled
properly even if volume migration is failed. If the migration is
in the migrating phase, the volume should be deleted and an entry
of database is also destroyed because the source volume is remaining.

Also there is an another problem that a source volume is remaining
as migrating status if create_export raises exception. In this case,
source volume can't be deleted even if it will be unnecessary.

This change fixes these two problems.

Closes-Bug: #1403916
Change-Id: Ie4199bc1e804e5cbbb793f448a99487f9823f1a9
"}]
commit_message:
Clear migration_status from a destination volume if migration fails

When some error happens during volume migration, cinder-volume
keeps remaining a destination volume because the volume copy may be
in the completing phase and a source volume may be deleted already.

In this case, the migration_status of the destination volume in
data base should be cleared. As a result, the volume can be handled
properly even if volume migration is failed. If the migration is
in the migrating phase, the volume should be deleted and an entry
of database is also destroyed because the source volume is remaining.

Also there is an another problem that a source volume is remaining
as migrating status if create_export raises exception. In this case,
source volume can't be deleted even if it will be unnecessary.

This change fixes these two problems.

Closes-Bug: #1403916
Change-Id: Ie4199bc1e804e5cbbb793f448a99487f9823f1a9

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-27 21:36:22.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/test_rbd.py'], 'message': 'RBD: Query volume features from ceph.conf

This patch enabled RADOSClient to query the local ceph.conf for rbd
features configuration, falling back to layering if nothing is found.
This allows users to disable default features or to opt in to upcoming
features that have not yet become default.

Change-Id: I758e028abd703942ceb1c5b63c4b734817bc5df3
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Query volume features from ceph.conf

This patch enabled RADOSClient to query the local ceph.conf for rbd
features configuration, falling back to layering if nothing is found.
This allows users to disable default features or to opt in to upcoming
features that have not yet become default.

Change-Id: I758e028abd703942ceb1c5b63c4b734817bc5df3

commit_message:
Changed filters to remove nova calls.

WIP - DO NOT MERGE

Remove the use of nova DB/API calls by the filters that require a host's
instance information to make their filtering decisions, as that
information is now contained in the host_state object.

commit_message:
Make compute update scheduler instance info.

WIP - DO NOT MERGE
This is proof-of-concept code, pending approval of the associated spec.

This patch adds the calls from compute to the scheduler client to pass
along the updated instance information for that compute node. It also
includes a new CONF setting to enable a deployment to disable sending
this information if they are not using any of the filters relating to
instances.

Change-Id: Iecfa26053a316b4eb79fe1447354da00e4db7dca

subject: Remove transaction timestamp from container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-02 18:42:40.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/object_store/v1/test_container.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/container.py'], 'message': 'Remove transaction timestamp from container

The x-timestamp header is the timestamp of the transaction and
it is not directly related to the container.  If we want to
return transaction data, we should have some other way other than
making them attributes of the resource.

Change-Id: I473c48c5df01b7fdbf80029600892f7bfdbb31f9
'}]
commit_message:
Remove transaction timestamp from container

The x-timestamp header is the timestamp of the transaction and
it is not directly related to the container.  If we want to
return transaction data, we should have some other way other than
making them attributes of the resource.

Change-Id: I473c48c5df01b7fdbf80029600892f7bfdbb31f9

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-27 21:36:22.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/test_rbd.py'], 'message': 'RBD: remove non-layering support for antiquated versions

RBD layering was first included in Bobtail (Jan 2013) and all current
Cinder users are expected to have upgraded to a newer version by now.

This patch removes the logic necessary to accommodate Ceph versions that
predate Bobtail.

Change-Id: I335414868c0d0c8c5b15ca0aea9ab32bceeed6ac
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: remove non-layering support for antiquated versions

RBD layering was first included in Bobtail (Jan 2013) and all current
Cinder users are expected to have upgraded to a newer version by now.

This patch removes the logic necessary to accommodate Ceph versions that
predate Bobtail.

Change-Id: I335414868c0d0c8c5b15ca0aea9ab32bceeed6ac

commit_message:
VPNaaS: Restructure test dir layout

To prepare for functional jobs for both StrongSwan and OpenSwan
implementations, the directory structure will be modified as follows:

- Create strongswan sub-dir for StrongSwan specific tests
- Create openswan sub-dir for OpenSwan specific tests
- Move the placeholder (dummy) OpenSwan test module in the new
  openswan area.

Note: The moved test module should still function under the current
functional job, as it is still under the tests/functional/ area.

FYI: Review 158389 adds the StrongSwan functional job, and filters
the files for both existing (OpenSwan) and new (StrongSwan)
implementations.

FYI: Review 158560 adds a StrongSwan functonal test module.

Change-Id: I2a10c5790bbe0e788e3924cf7b56d89bfb878796
Partial-Bug: 1424757

Adds a BaseInterface parent class for drivers implementing cleaning,
which adds common get_clean_steps and execute_clean_steps functions.
This class may become the parent of all Driver Interface classes in
the future. Adds a @clean_step decorator, which can be used to expose
certain driver functions as zapping and/or cleaning steps.

Implements blueprint implement-cleaning-states

Change-Id: Iceb1497cb0445163f1df9a18d6d1c27d9ac7a9a9
'}]
commit_message:
Implement Cleaning in DriverInterfaces

Adds a BaseInterface parent class for drivers implementing cleaning,
which adds common get_clean_steps and execute_clean_steps functions.
This class may become the parent of all Driver Interface classes in
the future. Adds a @clean_step decorator, which can be used to expose
certain driver functions as zapping and/or cleaning steps.

Implements blueprint implement-cleaning-states

Change-Id: Iceb1497cb0445163f1df9a18d6d1c27d9ac7a9a9

If there is `admin' user then image is created using the first available

commit_message:
Add the context custom_image

Add a new context with the name `custom_image'. This context is
hidden and acts as the base for the contexts of the virtual machine
boot from a custom prepared images. This is used for e.g. preparing
an image with benchmark application preinstalled.

If there is `admin' user then image is created using the first available
user and then makes it public using the `admin' user.
If no `admin' user is available then image is created for each user.

Co-Authored-By: Tzanetos Balitsaris <tzabal@freebsd.org>
Implements: blueprint benchmark-vms
Change-Id: I63a6a0f0f8f1270014ef8322b8e1998b162eb760

commit_message:
Make tempest's python 2.6 policy clear

This commit adds a few sentences to the end of the python 2.6 section
in the readme to clearly articulate that there is no python 2.6 in
tempest starting with kilo, and that patches to fix python 2.6 support
will be rejected.

Change-Id: I28b4714e35b84642be47961d3f51343450504db7

commit_message:
Creating a new volume_type's extra_specs returns a relative path

Change a returned url from an absolute path to a relative path. The
absolute path caused 404 error when Horizon isn't deployed at "/"
of the WEB server.

Change-Id: I8c99be662841bdb8e6f66679a0b1e4e2eb437da7
Closes-Bug: #1427053

I believe this was erroneously removed, the changes that should have
been made have been made in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158045/

We wanted to get rid of the juno/icehouse jobs, not the one that
tests off of master.

commit_message:
Revert "Remove lib-forward-testing from openstackclient"

I believe this was erroneously removed, the changes that should have
been made have been made in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158045/

We wanted to get rid of the juno/icehouse jobs, not the one that
tests off of master.

As of now, osc is just performing python-related jobs and a functional
test. We need a DSVM test.

This reverts commit 33a6babe6a5a1dcdabb701bd986a239ecb9daef3.

Change-Id: Id01f0c9bcf246ab7263e78231bbb442d38652b69

subject: Show fully qualified store name in update_capabilities() logging
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-01 16:33:10.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/capabilities.py'], 'message': "Show fully qualified store name in update_capabilities() logging

Current debug log in StoreCapability.update_capabilities() used the
basic class name of store driver, but since different driver uses same
class name - Store, so it doesn't make any senese for people who checks
this log, who can't figure out which store the log was talking about.

Change-Id: I4e22a3a84003909a66f5edaa6298c68e9fdb43e2
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Show fully qualified store name in update_capabilities() logging

Current debug log in StoreCapability.update_capabilities() used the
basic class name of store driver, but since different driver uses same
class name - Store, so it doesn't make any senese for people who checks
this log, who can't figure out which store the log was talking about.

Change-Id: I4e22a3a84003909a66f5edaa6298c68e9fdb43e2
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

subject: Adopt CLI sorting argument guidelines
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-25 18:52:29.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/tests/v2/test_volumes.py', 'cinderclient/tests/v2/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volumes.py', 'cinderclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': "Adopt CLI sorting argument guidelines

CLI sorting guidelines are defined in the cross project specs
repository: [1]

This patch deprecates --sort_key and --sort_dir and adds support for
--sort in the 'cinder list' command with the following syntax:

  cinder list --sort <key>[:<direction>]

The --sort parameter is comma-separated and is used to specify
one or more sort keys and directions.

Server-side work for sorting by multiple keys is handled in [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-specs/blob/master/specs/
    cli-sorting-args.rst
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141915/

Implements: blueprint cinder-pagination

Change-Id: Ie8c2c62b8c129f647f85d66d5bcfe4c8f0f4eedb
"}]
commit_message:
Adopt CLI sorting argument guidelines

CLI sorting guidelines are defined in the cross project specs
repository: [1]

This patch deprecates --sort_key and --sort_dir and adds support for
--sort in the 'cinder list' command with the following syntax:

  cinder list --sort <key>[:<direction>]

The --sort parameter is comma-separated and is used to specify
one or more sort keys and directions.

Server-side work for sorting by multiple keys is handled in [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-specs/blob/master/specs/
    cli-sorting-args.rst
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141915/

Implements: blueprint cinder-pagination

Change-Id: Ie8c2c62b8c129f647f85d66d5bcfe4c8f0f4eedb

commit_message:
Remove duplications from docco

This patch removes some duplications which we have since the Admin
Guide for Ceilometer exists. The Measurements section is moved
under contributing, as the list of meters is now moved to OPenStack
Manuals. The corresponding patch sets available here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/openstack-manuals+branch:master+topic:telemetry-measurements,n,z

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 8978, 'name': 'Marek Denis', 'email': 'marek.denis+openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'marek-denis'}, {'_account_id': 9142, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'samuel-z', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 13478, 'name': 'Boris Bobrov', 'email': 'b.bobrov@sap.com', 'username': 'bbobrov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-03-02 05:14:27.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_auth_plugin.py', 'keystone/auth/controllers.py', 'keystone/hacking/checks.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'keystone/common/kvs/backends/memcached.py', 'keystone/contrib/revoke/model.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/common/wsgi.py', 'keystone/contrib/endpoint_filter/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_cache_backend_mongo.py', 'keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/trust/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/fakeldap.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_hacking_checks.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/rest.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/backend/role/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_kvs.py', 'keystone/common/cache/backends/mongo.py', 'keystone/common/sql/core.py', 'keystone/exception.py', 'keystone/contrib/federation/utils.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/ksfixtures/hacking.py', 'keystone/contrib/oauth1/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_controller.py'], 'message': "Use dict comprehensions instead of dict constructor

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions [1], these are benefits:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.

Keystone dropped python 2.6 support in Kilo, we can leaverage this now.
There is deep dive about PEP-0274[2] and basic tests about
performance[3].

Note: This commit doesn't handle dict constructor with kwargs.
This commit also adds a hacking rule.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/
[2]http://doughellmann.com/2012/11/12/the-performance-impact-of-using-dict-instead-of-in-cpython-2-7-2.html
[3]http://paste.openstack.org/show/154798

Change-Id: Ie74719d0c969fa7819c243d5b162df6656c1e136
"}]
commit_message:
Use dict comprehensions instead of dict constructor

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions [1], these are benefits:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.

Keystone dropped python 2.6 support in Kilo, we can leaverage this now.
There is deep dive about PEP-0274[2] and basic tests about
performance[3].

Note: This commit doesn't handle dict constructor with kwargs.
This commit also adds a hacking rule.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/
[2]http://doughellmann.com/2012/11/12/the-performance-impact-of-using-dict-instead-of-in-cpython-2-7-2.html
[3]http://paste.openstack.org/show/154798

Change-Id: Ie74719d0c969fa7819c243d5b162df6656c1e136

commit_message:
PLUMgrid plugin decomposition

As part of the plugin decomposition work, this change
removes PLUMgrid plugin code from Neutron and moves it
to networking-plumgrid repo [1]. Plugin code, config,
drivers and unit test cases are all moved to
networking-plumgrid.

Updated vendor decomposition progress chart

[1] https://github.com/stackforge/networking-plumgrid

Partially-implements: blueprint core-vendor-decomposition
Closes-bug: #1426752
Change-Id: I34c952d1c259f44ed8028ded0b58a5db908dd245

commit_message:
Improve structure of Vendor Decomposition progress chart

After a few commits started being proposed, it became clear that, in
order to minimize merge conflicts, or potential errors with hyperlinks,
the structure had to change/improve slightly.

This patch proposes a different structure that aims at addressing
this concern.

Partial-implements: blueprint core-vendor-decomposition

Change-Id: I47ab4f946b88f0e4450908aedb1718d99435ff1d

commit_message:
PXE drivers support for IPA

This patch extend the pxe.VendorPassthru class to make it possible to
deploy a node using either the current default ramdisk built with DIB
or IPA.

Change-Id: Iaabc6ada729461f18d69ee12d01b9f1465944454
Depends-On: I32ec9fa74182c0d03c7ef1b698b1d0c0e3007773

commit_message:
Add howto for creating PTR records

PTR records can be a little tricky as they require a zone for both the
domain that the reverse lookup will point to as well as an
in-addr.arpa. zone.

Change-Id: I7f95dd0411f7715bbbfca11b1252cd77df1e88c6

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-02-26 11:35:58.000000000', 'files': ['utils/fuel_logs/fuel_logs.py'], 'message': 'Add fuel_logs tool

This tool can extract the useful lines from Astute and Puppet logs
within the Fuel log snapshot or on the live Fuel master node.

usage: fuel_logs [-h] [--astute] [--puppet] [--clear] [--sort] [--evals]
                 [--mcagent] [--less]
                 [SNAPSHOT [SNAPSHOT ...]]

positional arguments:
  SNAPSHOT       Take logs from these snapshots

optional arguments:
  -h, --help     show this help message and exit
  --astute, -a   Parse Astute log
  --puppet, -p   Parse Puppet logs
  --clear, -c    Clear the logs on the master node
  --sort, -s     Sort Puppet logs by date
  --evals, -e    Show Puppet evaltrace lines
  --mcagent, -m  Show Astute MCAgent calls debug
  --less, -l     Redirect data to the "less" pager

Using anywhere to view Fuel snapshot data:

fuel_logs.py fail_error_deploy_ha_vlan-2015_02_20__20_35_18.tar.gz

Using on the live Fuel Master node:

fuel_logs.py -a View the current Astute log
fuel_logs.py -p View the current Puppet logs

Using without -a and -p options assumes both options

fuel_logs.py -c Truncates Astute and Puppet logs. Respects -a and -p options.

It you are running and debugging many deployments on a single master node
you may want to truncate the logs from the previous deployments. Using -l
option is aslo recomended for interactive use.

Closes-Bug: 1425126
DocImpact: ops guide
Change-Id: I0699507e6ecf2aac6a12b455542137fd4068122a
'}]
commit_message:
Add fuel_logs tool

This tool can extract the useful lines from Astute and Puppet logs
within the Fuel log snapshot or on the live Fuel master node.

usage: fuel_logs [-h] [--astute] [--puppet] [--clear] [--sort] [--evals]
                 [--mcagent] [--less]
                 [SNAPSHOT [SNAPSHOT ...]]

positional arguments:
  SNAPSHOT       Take logs from these snapshots

optional arguments:
  -h, --help     show this help message and exit
  --astute, -a   Parse Astute log
  --puppet, -p   Parse Puppet logs
  --clear, -c    Clear the logs on the master node
  --sort, -s     Sort Puppet logs by date
  --evals, -e    Show Puppet evaltrace lines
  --mcagent, -m  Show Astute MCAgent calls debug
  --less, -l     Redirect data to the "less" pager

Using anywhere to view Fuel snapshot data:

fuel_logs.py fail_error_deploy_ha_vlan-2015_02_20__20_35_18.tar.gz

Using on the live Fuel Master node:

fuel_logs.py -a View the current Astute log
fuel_logs.py -p View the current Puppet logs

Using without -a and -p options assumes both options

fuel_logs.py -c Truncates Astute and Puppet logs. Respects -a and -p options.

It you are running and debugging many deployments on a single master node
you may want to truncate the logs from the previous deployments. Using -l
option is aslo recomended for interactive use.

Closes-Bug: 1425126
DocImpact: ops guide
Change-Id: I0699507e6ecf2aac6a12b455542137fd4068122a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-27 21:22:05.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': "Fix glob pattern for os-ansible-logs publisher

Neither Ant's nor infra's documentation is clear, but it appears that
keep-hierarchy shouldn't be true when also specifying a pattern that
only looks for filenames that match a pattern. Instead, just copy all of
the sub-directories and their contents within /openstack/log to ensure
all log files are copied during os-ansible-deployment gate-commit-check
jobs.

Change-Id: I0b3d8c0b81a1cd26806be824843290f4153daee0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix glob pattern for os-ansible-logs publisher

Neither Ant's nor infra's documentation is clear, but it appears that
keep-hierarchy shouldn't be true when also specifying a pattern that
only looks for filenames that match a pattern. Instead, just copy all of
the sub-directories and their contents within /openstack/log to ensure
all log files are copied during os-ansible-deployment gate-commit-check
jobs.

Change-Id: I0b3d8c0b81a1cd26806be824843290f4153daee0

The admin user defined in nailgun should not be used for any service

so that it's harder to abuse this as a usage.

commit_message:
Move admin user and openrc up so that its not relied on

The admin user defined in nailgun should not be used for any service
purpose. This pulls the user out of the lower levels of the manifests
so that it's harder to abuse this as a usage.

Commonly other modules have an their own admin {user,password,tenant}
parameters which should not be confused with this admin user which is
only for the enduser to consume.

Related-bug: #1396594
Related-bug: #1347542

Change-Id: Ie991a64617919727724638d582af301ee4519655

subject: Fix Unauthorized exception after auth_token expire
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-28 01:26:48.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datasources/glancev2_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/ironic_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix Unauthorized exception after auth_token expire

Current glanceclient and ironicclient will raise unauthorized
exception when auth token expired after a long run. This is a
workaround since it's better to fix it in the domain client side
as what novaclient and neutronclient do.

Change-Id: I1f9cf993dac4f1775d2364349a659f670baf4d3f
Closes-Bug: #1422582
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Unauthorized exception after auth_token expire

Current glanceclient and ironicclient will raise unauthorized
exception when auth token expired after a long run. This is a
workaround since it's better to fix it in the domain client side
as what novaclient and neutronclient do.

Change-Id: I1f9cf993dac4f1775d2364349a659f670baf4d3f
Closes-Bug: #1422582

commit_message:
Remove email from examples in Identity API

We do not support email as a first class atribute, yet we
include it in many of the examples of the user API. This
patch removes email from those examples.

Change-Id: Iae95a6fd1fcc4a8ed5564756397155e5ea8d94c3
Closes-bug: 1426310

subject: Correct the use of POST for domain configs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-27 16:44:42.000000000', 'files': ['api/v3/identity-api-v3.rst'], 'message': "Correct the use of POST for domain configs

The API spec hints that you should use POST to create domain
specific configs for a domain, whereas in fact you should use
PUT, since the URL isn't technically valid until after you
have created the config.

Change-Id: Id17e642c95c1a627a4036f057d5761f25ed853c1
Closes-bug: 1426448
"}]
commit_message:
Correct the use of POST for domain configs

The API spec hints that you should use POST to create domain
specific configs for a domain, whereas in fact you should use
PUT, since the URL isn't technically valid until after you
have created the config.

Change-Id: Id17e642c95c1a627a4036f057d5761f25ed853c1
Closes-bug: 1426448

subject: It seems git requires a name and email
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-01-15 18:03:33.000000000', 'files': ['spec/ring-repo_spec.rb', 'recipes/ring-repo.rb'], 'message': 'It seems git requires a name and email

STDERR: *** Please tell me who you are.
Run
git config --global user.email "you@example.com"
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
to set your account's default identity.

Omit --global to set the identity only in this repository.
fatal: empty ident name (for <swift@aio-storage>) not allowed

Change-Id: Ibf5bdd583c10c134d10de4893bb345f66fe03431
Blueprint: object-storage-cleanup
'}]
commit_message:
It seems git requires a name and email

STDERR: *** Please tell me who you are.
Run
git config --global user.email "you@example.com"
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
to set your account's default identity.

Omit --global to set the identity only in this repository.
fatal: empty ident name (for <swift@aio-storage>) not allowed

Change-Id: Ibf5bdd583c10c134d10de4893bb345f66fe03431
Blueprint: object-storage-cleanup

subject: Support script text override for newer develop
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-03 22:05:56.000000000', 'files': ['tools/integration.sh', 'pbr/packaging.py', 'pbr/hooks/commands.py'], 'message': "Support script text override for newer develop

setuptools > 12 has a new flow for writing out generated script text.
It's nicer, actually, because it means we can just subclass and extend
one method instead of monekypatching.

Closes-Bug: 1415106
Change-Id: I56e7bea60df8a59d859575d426ce93c45ffee314
"}]
commit_message:
Support script text override for newer develop

setuptools > 12 has a new flow for writing out generated script text.
It's nicer, actually, because it means we can just subclass and extend
one method instead of monekypatching.

Closes-Bug: 1415106
Change-Id: I56e7bea60df8a59d859575d426ce93c45ffee314

commit_message:
Use correct dependency decorator

OAuth, Federation, and Revoke extensions are all started and
configured automatically, we should use the requires decorator
instead of the optional decorator.

partially implements bp replace-extensions

Change-Id: I2062ce2005137c53046d9f456f1674ed9ea32e67

commit_message:
No need to re-fetch instance with sysmeta

Since ca9b5bf769ee57c1135c47e259990a86b3e49daf merged there is no
longer a need to re-fetch instance with system_metadata before
calling get_instance_nw_info().

Change-Id: Ic272d0b846e8e4809db03faf561c809a76c15112

commit_message:
Break default auth plugin into file

Extract the default auth plugin into its own file. In future I'd like to
move the whole auth loading process into this file - however I have some
ideas for changing around how config works I'd like to do first.

Change-Id: I90c2f9e55947a436374ff54465e15caffdf9925d
Implements: bp refactor-extract-module

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-27 10:29:09.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/compute/section_compute-scheduler.xml'], 'message': 'Reference to volume scheduling removed from Compute section

As of Juno, the config guide still claims that the Nova scheduler takes 
care of volume scheduling requests. This functionality has been in Cinder 
for years. Similarly, the MultiScheduler mentioned in the config guide 
dates from the times when Nova managed volumes and is now obsolete.

Fix: In the sentence "Compute uses the nova-scheduler service to 
determine how to dispatch compute and volume requests", removed the words 
"and volume". Also removed the line 
"scheduler_driver=nova.scheduler.multi.MultiScheduler" from the nova.conf 
example.

Closes-Bug: #1423788
Change-Id: I2046c81a730083891a7d1107aa754232fcfa9e61
'}]
commit_message:
Reference to volume scheduling removed from Compute section

As of Juno, the config guide still claims that the Nova scheduler takes 
care of volume scheduling requests. This functionality has been in Cinder 
for years. Similarly, the MultiScheduler mentioned in the config guide 
dates from the times when Nova managed volumes and is now obsolete.

Fix: In the sentence "Compute uses the nova-scheduler service to 
determine how to dispatch compute and volume requests", removed the words 
"and volume". Also removed the line 
"scheduler_driver=nova.scheduler.multi.MultiScheduler" from the nova.conf 
example.

Closes-Bug: #1423788
Change-Id: I2046c81a730083891a7d1107aa754232fcfa9e61
