commit_message:
Split failover tests to separate cases for nova and neutron

We have the same test cases for nova and neutron in test_failover
that are started in different threads with different settings.

Test cases remain the same but are called from different test
methods (separately for nova and for neutron) to provide
dependency on different environments and snapshots.

test_failover.py separated into test_failover.py and
test_failover_base.py for more suitable developing.

Change-Id: Ib0a01b621c1a0b5d8ed3eadbc21262509563ddc4
Closes-Bug: #1422295

subject: Fix auth-required for help command
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-27 23:27:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/api/auth.py', 'examples/osc-lib.py', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/tests/common/test_clientmanager.py', 'openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': 'Fix auth-required for help command

When we got picky with the auth arguments we broke using help without
any auth config supplied.  This rearranges things a bit to do the argument
checking when the deferred auth request to Identity occurs so commands
that do not need auth have a chance to live short but useful lives.

Closes-Bug: #1399588
Change-Id: I8ceac491cf65e25eddb62ab2713f471fe686756d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix auth-required for help command

When we got picky with the auth arguments we broke using help without
any auth config supplied.  This rearranges things a bit to do the argument
checking when the deferred auth request to Identity occurs so commands
that do not need auth have a chance to live short but useful lives.

Closes-Bug: #1399588
Change-Id: I8ceac491cf65e25eddb62ab2713f471fe686756d

commit_message:
Manila access-allow API doesn't accept backslash

The access-allow API should accept backslash characters so
that one may enter a Windows domain user, such as MYDOMAIN\Administrator.
This must also be fixed in the client.

Change-Id: I955b67781d4d9361ab79389a8d3a1dc0159d2cd4
Closes-Bug: #1426099

commit_message:
Set tcp_keepalive_time to 300 on MongoDB nodes

The default value of 30 seconds may cause socket errors between members
of a cluster. Setting it to 300 is recommended in the official
documentation[1].

Exclude controllers not to overwrite the fix for
Ic9d491f4904a5e665278027fc37254003c4b5172.

[1] http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/faq/diagnostics/

Change-Id: If79702fbf51da8b68fde8a7f50f286656335cd5c
Closes-Bug: 1424919

commit_message:
Add keystone v3 support to client

All clients should support keystone v3 in kilo. This patch adds
support for keystone sessions, keystone endpoint discovery and support
for the CLI to provide keystone v3 options.

Bumps python-keystoneclient to >=0.11.1 to bring in session support.

This patch was previously dependent on a separate one to add session
support but that work has been squashed into this and its review
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/131309) will be abandoned.

Change-Id: I277008c1092b3e1abbbb3f76eb1bb36123f928be
Co-Authored-By: David Hu <david.hu@hp.com>
Closes-Bug: #1354129
Implements: blueprint support-keystone-v3

subject: Ignore top-level merge items which evaluate False
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 20:45:43.000000000', 'files': ['os_apply_config/tests/test_collect_config.py', 'os_apply_config/collect_config.py'], 'message': "Ignore top-level merge items which evaluate False

There has been recent tripleo regressions caused by heat
setting empty config as '' rather than {} which cause os-apply-config
to error on merge_configs.

This change ignores any top-level config which evaluates to False,
ignoring possible empty data including '', {}, None, []

An os-apply-config release with this fix would likely allow the current
heat pin to be removed Id134664a5df7232da0fb5d9ed62b82e12b3d54a8

Change-Id: Ia5bd99d1550f43760c064b769be3be46b3417331
Closes-Bug: #1426116
Related-Bug: #1425238
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore top-level merge items which evaluate False

There has been recent tripleo regressions caused by heat
setting empty config as '' rather than {} which cause os-apply-config
to error on merge_configs.

This change ignores any top-level config which evaluates to False,
ignoring possible empty data including '', {}, None, []

An os-apply-config release with this fix would likely allow the current
heat pin to be removed Id134664a5df7232da0fb5d9ed62b82e12b3d54a8

Change-Id: Ia5bd99d1550f43760c064b769be3be46b3417331
Closes-Bug: #1426116
Related-Bug: #1425238

subject: Detect YAQL version based on the distribution package
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-02 14:40:59.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Detect YAQL version based on the distribution package

YAQL version is now detected based on the package distribution.
If YAQL is not installed via setuptools (or is installed but is run from
different source) the version is undefined.

Package version is temporary hardcoded in setup.cfg as 1.0.0b1, however
it has to be removed before the release: the versions have to be defined
based on the git tags. Right now latest remote tag in master branch is 0.2,
so we have to manually add version to setup.cfg.
As soon as 1.0 tag is added to remote, version field has to be removed.

Change-Id: I5b9a6d724cb5cfc7f33c5d79f5862b4edecc5d27
'}]
commit_message:
Detect YAQL version based on the distribution package

YAQL version is now detected based on the package distribution.
If YAQL is not installed via setuptools (or is installed but is run from
different source) the version is undefined.

Package version is temporary hardcoded in setup.cfg as 1.0.0b1, however
it has to be removed before the release: the versions have to be defined
based on the git tags. Right now latest remote tag in master branch is 0.2,
so we have to manually add version to setup.cfg.
As soon as 1.0 tag is added to remote, version field has to be removed.

Change-Id: I5b9a6d724cb5cfc7f33c5d79f5862b4edecc5d27

All projects being tested successfully against Python 3.3 are
confirmed to also work with the Python 3.4 on Ubuntu Trusty, or
those which could not have been temporarily suspended in an earlier
change. In an effort to remove our custom py3k-precise Ubuntu

'}]
commit_message:
Switch from Python 3.3 to 3.4 for Py3K jobs

All projects being tested successfully against Python 3.3 are
confirmed to also work with the Python 3.4 on Ubuntu Trusty, or
those which could not have been temporarily suspended in an earlier
change. In an effort to remove our custom py3k-precise Ubuntu
Precise based Python 3.3 testing platform, switch them all to 3.4 on
standard bare-trusty images.

Change-Id: Ie105674833e0a527f990a7448855a1090f5dc651

revisions:
[{'number': 57, 'created': '2015-03-02 01:20:02.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Fix the check/merge jobs for ODL

This patch fixes the pluggable devstack for ODL such that ODL can now
run in the OpenStack gate for the check-tempest-dsvm-networking-odl
job. Notably, there was an issue where we were running "bin/karaf" to
start ODL. This started the console in the screen session. However,
somehow screen was sending a "ctrl-d" to karaf, which was causing it
to exit. We now run "bin/start" which starts karaf in daemon mode. We
also explicitly set things like memory for karaf as well.

Fix a few other small nits while in here.

Change-Id: Iedb3dddac433c8dcf7b46f8119f2e14e3f5db2fd
Closes-Bug: #1426212
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the check/merge jobs for ODL

This patch fixes the pluggable devstack for ODL such that ODL can now
run in the OpenStack gate for the check-tempest-dsvm-networking-odl
job. Notably, there was an issue where we were running "bin/karaf" to
start ODL. This started the console in the screen session. However,
somehow screen was sending a "ctrl-d" to karaf, which was causing it
to exit. We now run "bin/start" which starts karaf in daemon mode. We
also explicitly set things like memory for karaf as well.

Fix a few other small nits while in here.

Change-Id: Iedb3dddac433c8dcf7b46f8119f2e14e3f5db2fd
Closes-Bug: #1426212

commit_message:
Missing commas in one-element tuples

In data processing views some workflow views use ("ajax-modal")
for classes variable. However one-elemented tuple needs a comma
at the end, otherwise it's a string.

Change-Id: I3c3e9fb0729a21aa56a604dcbd1194b13baccfb8

commit_message:
Don't let modify tempest options

For some reason, IPV6_ENABLED gets overrided somewhere before to load
the settings file in ./stack.sh workflow. Force it to false. Do the
same for the extensions.

Change-Id: I7bf4f2999c55613fe249445878309f192498384c

subject: Delete support for vendored OpenStack resources
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 5538, 'name': 'Rushi Agrawal', 'email': 'rushi.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'rushiagr'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 7253, 'name': 'Jason Dunsmore', 'email': 'jasondunsmore@gmail.com', 'username': 'jbd'}, {'_account_id': 7256, 'name': 'Randall Burt', 'email': 'randall.burt@rackspace.com', 'username': 'randall-burt'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-25 19:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_cloud_loadbalancer.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_cloudnetworks.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_auto_scale.py', 'contrib/rackspace/README.md', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/resources/auto_scale.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_rackspace_dns.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/clients.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/resources/cloud_dns.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/resources/cloud_loadbalancer.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/resources/__init__.py', 'contrib/rackspace/setup.cfg', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/resources/cloudnetworks.py', 'contrib/rackspace/setup.py', 'contrib/rackspace/requirements.txt', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/resources/cloud_server.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/__init__.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_rackspace_cloud_server.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/__init__.py'], 'message': "Delete support for vendored OpenStack resources

It's not the job of OpenStack to care for non-OpenStack resources, or
to support vendor variance in resources that are OpenStack.

While it can be helpful to have resources in the contrib/ tree for
non-OpenStack resources, such as auto-scaling, having them there for
compatibility with things that are otherwise OpenStack but work
strangely seems counter-productive to the goals of having interoperable
OpenStack clouds.

Specifically, the fact that interaction with OpenStack services is done
using pyrax and not python-*client reduces the motivation to fix or
improve python-*client.

Change-Id: I8f8eb66b33753cd17a110c0b32156282793b1638
"}]
commit_message:
Delete support for vendored OpenStack resources

It's not the job of OpenStack to care for non-OpenStack resources, or
to support vendor variance in resources that are OpenStack.

While it can be helpful to have resources in the contrib/ tree for
non-OpenStack resources, such as auto-scaling, having them there for
compatibility with things that are otherwise OpenStack but work
strangely seems counter-productive to the goals of having interoperable
OpenStack clouds.

Specifically, the fact that interaction with OpenStack services is done
using pyrax and not python-*client reduces the motivation to fix or
improve python-*client.

Change-Id: I8f8eb66b33753cd17a110c0b32156282793b1638

Return 409 status instead of 500 if package exists

409 CONFLICT status seems adequate
for a situation when we upload a package with the name
that has been registered already, as it is an expected
error.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-25 02:49:07.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/improved-secret-storage.rst'], 'message': 'Adding improved secret storage spec

There are several secrets (for example passwords) that Sahara uses with
respect to deployed frameworks which are currently stored in its
database. This specification proposes the creation of a Barbican integration
module that will allow Sahara to offload secret storage to that service.
The initial focus of this offloading effort will focus on the storage of
Swift credentials.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I7b5b38b5b10f7e88893dca8792a298537b69cf05
Partial-implements: bp improved-secret-storage
'}]
commit_message:
Adding improved secret storage spec

There are several secrets (for example passwords) that Sahara uses with
respect to deployed frameworks which are currently stored in its
database. This specification proposes the creation of a Barbican integration
module that will allow Sahara to offload secret storage to that service.
The initial focus of this offloading effort will focus on the storage of
Swift credentials.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: I7b5b38b5b10f7e88893dca8792a298537b69cf05
Partial-implements: bp improved-secret-storage

subject: Append ChangeLog into the long_description
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-07-27 19:23:26.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/packaging.py'], 'message': "Append ChangeLog into the long_description

PyPI shows the long_description on the page for a software project.
Many people would like to see the most recent change as part of that.
In support of that, append the 5 most recent tags worth of changes
to the end of the long description.

Note: this is only on RST format, which is what PyPI displays. We'll
follow up with a patch to restrict README format to RST.

Change-Id: Ibc0eebd1da0e3ff49421b44e1bcc5800a5237ae1
"}]
commit_message:
Append ChangeLog into the long_description

PyPI shows the long_description on the page for a software project.
Many people would like to see the most recent change as part of that.
In support of that, append the 5 most recent tags worth of changes
to the end of the long description.

Note: this is only on RST format, which is what PyPI displays. We'll
follow up with a patch to restrict README format to RST.

Change-Id: Ibc0eebd1da0e3ff49421b44e1bcc5800a5237ae1

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-01 22:02:05.000000000', 'files': ['resolutions/20140920-remove-vendor-compat.rst'], 'message': "Remove support for vendor extensions from our code

There are several places throughout the OpenStack codebases where
code or documentation exists to support compatibility with a vendor
divergence. OpenStack provides a massive amount of legitimate leeway
and flexibility for vendors to express themselves. When a vendor can't
stay within those admittedly very shallow bounds, it should not be
incumbent upon OpenStack to take up the slack or provide remediation.
The cost of carrying the variance should be on the vendor, with the
hopes that such cost might properly incent the vendor to align with
gusto.

Change-Id: Ifbcf3a519fcb85ac083ae412c1ee94cafa988e9c
"}]
commit_message:
Remove support for vendor extensions from our code

There are several places throughout the OpenStack codebases where
code or documentation exists to support compatibility with a vendor
divergence. OpenStack provides a massive amount of legitimate leeway
and flexibility for vendors to express themselves. When a vendor can't
stay within those admittedly very shallow bounds, it should not be
incumbent upon OpenStack to take up the slack or provide remediation.
The cost of carrying the variance should be on the vendor, with the
hopes that such cost might properly incent the vendor to align with
gusto.

Change-Id: Ifbcf3a519fcb85ac083ae412c1ee94cafa988e9c

subject: Install retrying before tooz
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-01 05:01:50.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Install retrying before tooz

We have a global requirements package pin on retrying, but tooz
is not gated on that, so if we install retrying after tooz, things
break. Also, while we're doing that, pbr and six need to be in the
order dependent section.

Change-Id: Id1e7d738cf2603a58a4c8238008b8f13efc65081
"}]
commit_message:
Install retrying before tooz

We have a global requirements package pin on retrying, but tooz
is not gated on that, so if we install retrying after tooz, things
break. Also, while we're doing that, pbr and six need to be in the
order dependent section.

Change-Id: Id1e7d738cf2603a58a4c8238008b8f13efc65081

subject: Determine SQLA String and Text types as different
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-24 10:04:18.000000000', 'files': ['tests/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'Determine SQLA String and Text types as different

We should avoid of situation, when we set column type as sa.Text
in migrations and as sa.String in models, because this will not allow
to create DB schema from metadata.  Modified compare_type() method
to determine String and Text types as different.

Closes-Bug: #1385130

Change-Id: Ic97e6e761739f2e4c6715049c4d4159eed9edeae
'}]
commit_message:
Determine SQLA String and Text types as different

We should avoid of situation, when we set column type as sa.Text
in migrations and as sa.String in models, because this will not allow
to create DB schema from metadata.  Modified compare_type() method
to determine String and Text types as different.

Closes-Bug: #1385130

Change-Id: Ic97e6e761739f2e4c6715049c4d4159eed9edeae

commit_message:
Use oslo.log

Convert the use of the incubated version of the log module
to the new oslo.log library.

Sync oslo-incubator modules to update their imports as well.

Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Change-Id: Ic4932e3f58191869c30bd07a010a6e9fdcb2a12c

subject: Allow passing in parameters to get_all_clouds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-01 19:29:33.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py'], 'message': 'Allow passing in parameters to get_all_clouds

get_one_cloud supports passing in some additional parameters, but for no
good reason, get_all_clouds does not.

Change-Id: I8ac244202022e83f1b4a39ce4b84f2de609e3437
'}]
commit_message:
Allow passing in parameters to get_all_clouds

commit_message:
A functional libvirt + nova_compute + nova_network

This imports sdakes' nova-docker codebase to show that atomic upgrades
work atleast with nova networking.  This has many corrections.

For more details read:

http://sdake.io/2015/01/28/an-atomic-upgrade-process-for-openstack-compute-nodes/

Implements-blueprint: blueprint libvirt-container
Partially-implements; blueprint container-set-compute-operation-nova

Change-Id: I858ea113c5656b6da5d2fd13502fecdbd085c8da

commit_message:
Fixing platform test for Sahara

If we create a private network without subnets or for example,
DHCP agents, this network may be chosen by the test as the private
network for Sahara cluster. In this case the test will fail. Now
the default private network is chosen by the test as the private
network for Sahara cluster. This fix also affects Ceilometer tests.
So Ceilometer tests have the corresponding changes.

Closes-Bug: #1421739

Change-Id: I8fdac844eea1f48b3d6ea8e63c8adf11391b2cc9

commit_message:
Fix for deadlock in batch nodes deletion

Locking of cluster tasks and nodes added into NodeDeletionTaskManager.
Docstring for get_objects_list_or_404 method fixed.

Change-Id: I246f182dd847edf96edda9792abd4169fbd9beb3

Oozie shell actions provide a great deal of flexibility and will
empower users to easily customize and extend the features of Sahara
EDP as needed. For example, a shell action could be used to manage
hdfs on the cluster, do pre or post processing for another job

commit_message:
[EDP] Add Oozie Shell Action job type

Oozie shell actions provide a great deal of flexibility and will
empower users to easily customize and extend the features of Sahara
EDP as needed. For example, a shell action could be used to manage
hdfs on the cluster, do pre or post processing for another job
launched from Sahara, or run a data processing job from a
specialized launcher that does extra configuration not otherwise
available from Sahara (ie, setting a special classpath for a Java job).

blueprint: add-edp-shell-action
Change-Id: Ib975b9ca297611b245c012811b504b2716072c0c

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-20 14:39:20.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/edp-add-hbase-sharelib.rst'], 'message': 'Add a common HBase lib in hdfs on cluster start

HBase applications written in Java require JARs on the HBase classpath.
Java actions launched from Oozie may reference JARs stored in hdfs
using the `oozie.libpath` configuration value, but there is no
standard HBase directory location in hdfs that is installed with Oozie.

Users can build their own HBase directory in hdfs manually from a cluster
node but it would be convenient if Sahara provided an option to build
the directory at cluster launch time.

Blueprint: edp-add-hbase-lib
Change-Id: I343ccaf0bc1e843e8b10db5f95d8d9b224ecee0b
'}]
commit_message:
Add a common HBase lib in hdfs on cluster start

HBase applications written in Java require JARs on the HBase classpath.
Java actions launched from Oozie may reference JARs stored in hdfs
using the `oozie.libpath` configuration value, but there is no
standard HBase directory location in hdfs that is installed with Oozie.

Users can build their own HBase directory in hdfs manually from a cluster
node but it would be convenient if Sahara provided an option to build
the directory at cluster launch time.

Blueprint: edp-add-hbase-lib
Change-Id: I343ccaf0bc1e843e8b10db5f95d8d9b224ecee0b

* Support for kwargs and keyword-only args (Py3)
* Optional function arguments
* Smart algorithm to find matching function overload without side effects
* Ability to organize functions into layers
* Configurable list of operators (left/right associative binary, prefix/suffix unary with precedence)
* No global variables. There can be  more than one parser with different set of operators simultaneously
* List literals ([a, b])
* Dictionary literals ({ a => b})
* Handling of escape characters in string literals
* Verbatim strings (`...`) and double-quotes ("...")

commit_message:
yaql 1.0

* Support for kwargs and keyword-only args (Py3)
* Optional function arguments
* Smart algorithm to find matching function overload without side effects
* Ability to organize functions into layers
* Configurable list of operators (left/right associative binary, prefix/suffix unary with precedence)
* No global variables. There can be  more than one parser with different set of operators simultaneously
* List literals ([a, b])
* Dictionary literals ({ a => b})
* Handling of escape characters in string literals
* Verbatim strings (`...`) and double-quotes ("...")
* =~ and !~ operators in default configuration (similar to Perl)
* -> operator to pass context
* Alternate operator names (for example '*equal' instead of '#operator_=')
   so that it will be possible to have different symbol for particular operator
   without breaking standard library that expects operator to have well known names
* Set operations
* Support for lists and dictionaries as a dictionary keys and set elements
* New framework to decorate functions
* Ability to distinguish between functions and methods
* Switchable naming conventions
* Unicode support
* Execution options available to all invoked functions
* Iterators limitation
* Ability to limit memory consumption
* Can work with custom context classes
* It is possible to extend both parser and set of expression classes on user-side
* It is possible to create user-defined types (also can be used for dependency injection)
* Legacy yaql 0.2.x backward compatibility mode
* Comprehensive standard library of functions
* High unit test coverage

Change-Id: Ie31b7c3cbadbff5b7728f55b3ba7bcb78a39d156

subject: wip: let LOG.debug take a stack= parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-16 21:23:08.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/_options.py', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/log.py'], 'message': "wip: let LOG.debug take a stack= parameter

One of the problems with debugging in OpenStack is that with so much
functionality moved into libraries, which call debug, the debug suffix
- %(funcName)s %(pathname)s:%(lineno)d is often not very useful.

inner /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py:430
(the suffix on every lock call, for instance)

What would be helpful is if these debug calls could be tuned to look
further up the stack for their caller. The proposed idea here is
stack=N (where N is the number of stack frames to go back). When it
defaults to 1, it's the same behavior as before (using the new
%(caller)s keyword)

Alternatives: I originally looked into whether you could update
LogRecord fields, however they seem readonly.

This is very much a discussion patch to think about ways we might be
able to get this kind of functionality, hopefully better than this
approach.

Change-Id: Ic1f2a039635857215cd3baa0d72a23af8de7388e
"}]
commit_message:
wip: let LOG.debug take a stack= parameter

One of the problems with debugging in OpenStack is that with so much
functionality moved into libraries, which call debug, the debug suffix
- %(funcName)s %(pathname)s:%(lineno)d is often not very useful.

inner /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py:430
(the suffix on every lock call, for instance)

What would be helpful is if these debug calls could be tuned to look
further up the stack for their caller. The proposed idea here is
stack=N (where N is the number of stack frames to go back). When it
defaults to 1, it's the same behavior as before (using the new
%(caller)s keyword)

Alternatives: I originally looked into whether you could update
LogRecord fields, however they seem readonly.

This is very much a discussion patch to think about ways we might be
able to get this kind of functionality, hopefully better than this
approach.

Change-Id: Ic1f2a039635857215cd3baa0d72a23af8de7388e

commit_message:
Sync keystone.py with upstream to function with Juno

Keystone in Juno has changed and thus changes to keystone.py
are required for proper functionality. This patch syncs the
keystone.py with upstream as available at

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/keystone/stable/juno/httpd/keystone.py

Closes-Bug: #1425912
Change-Id: I3ce510adbe4e29e3d3857d976c341c13ea269694

subject: Move pylint checks to pep8 testenv
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-02 07:56:39.000000000', 'files': ['.pylintrc', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Move pylint checks to pep8 testenv

This change proposes to move pylint violation checks to the pep8
testenv. This changes make pylint gating within Neutron as it would
participate in the vote.  Having pylint executed on a separate job makes
it difficult to handle potential unexpected breakages, because we need
to get infra involved. When we need to renable the job, it is equally
painful.

Furthermore, it also causes us to spin an extra node, when the checks
can easily be handled by the node for the pep8 job.

Finally, having pylint running with tox -epep8 "helps" developers
become aware of pylint violations sooner rather than later, if they
"forget" to run the pylint testenv too before submitting the change.

In order to make this patch succeed, a couple of pylint violation
checks were skipped, as they slipped in, whilst the job was non-voting.

We'll tackle them in due course.

Neutron Change-Id: Ida6ae44a837d1761f5ce3e8a92f8850407f5cd16
Neutron commit c0aa0b37c0911558a2d91f1abff34e32dfe59bbe

Change-Id: Icd18bc0582e86f84b7f3eb7353ef5b148259f063
'}]
commit_message:
Move pylint checks to pep8 testenv

This change proposes to move pylint violation checks to the pep8
testenv. This changes make pylint gating within Neutron as it would
participate in the vote.  Having pylint executed on a separate job makes
it difficult to handle potential unexpected breakages, because we need
to get infra involved. When we need to renable the job, it is equally
painful.

Furthermore, it also causes us to spin an extra node, when the checks
can easily be handled by the node for the pep8 job.

Finally, having pylint running with tox -epep8 "helps" developers
become aware of pylint violations sooner rather than later, if they
"forget" to run the pylint testenv too before submitting the change.

In order to make this patch succeed, a couple of pylint violation
checks were skipped, as they slipped in, whilst the job was non-voting.

We'll tackle them in due course.

Neutron Change-Id: Ida6ae44a837d1761f5ce3e8a92f8850407f5cd16
Neutron commit c0aa0b37c0911558a2d91f1abff34e32dfe59bbe

Change-Id: Icd18bc0582e86f84b7f3eb7353ef5b148259f063

commit_message:
updated "neutron help router-update" info

Initially we were unable to see complete help
info for "neutron router-update" command.

Now, with this patch complete help info is
displayed to the user.

The following information will be displayed:-
    --name
    --admin-state-up
    --distributed

Change-Id: I09614c1c99414ffd78bc29a015217e3dbe654888

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-19 13:48:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Default route missing for IPv6 subnets in HA Router

In an HA setup, keepalived would configure the default gateway (in the master
HA router) by parsing the "virtual_routes" section of keepalived.conf file.
The "virtual_routes" section is properly constructed for an IPv4 subnet, but
requires a minor change for IPv6 subnets.

Closes-Bug: #1414937
Change-Id: I54070e048577292d98d86fcc9ca8b9d3e72b4ebe
'}]
commit_message:
Default route missing for IPv6 subnets in HA Router

In an HA setup, keepalived would configure the default gateway (in the master
HA router) by parsing the "virtual_routes" section of keepalived.conf file.
The "virtual_routes" section is properly constructed for an IPv4 subnet, but
requires a minor change for IPv6 subnets.

Closes-Bug: #1414937
Change-Id: I54070e048577292d98d86fcc9ca8b9d3e72b4ebe

commit_message:
Make del_fdb_flow() idempotent.

Addresses an issue where del_fdb_flow() gets a duplicate call for
the same port, which results in a KeyError. This change makes the
call more idempotent, so that it doesn't cause other follow-on
errors as a result of the uncaught exception.

Neutron Change-Id: I7a3a34dd654e143dee06c3e4642e859211a312ca
Neutron commit 841b2f58f375df53b380cf5796bb31c82cd09260
Closes-bug: #1421105

Change-Id: Ia168934b7346803fefc2c892784e9686992b7ad5

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-02 09:08:30.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/conductor/handlers/bay_k8s_heat.py'], 'message': 'Change default path of kubecluster.yaml to absolute one.

Currently the default path of template file
kubecluster.yaml was relative path. Due to which
magnum-conductor failed to start even if the file
exist. It was because os.path.isfile works with
absolute path only. Hence changing the default
value to absolute path.

Change-Id: I9acbd21cf178a1beee5df30389902577fefc6e48
Closes-bug: #1427069
'}]
commit_message:
Change default path of kubecluster.yaml to absolute one.

Currently the default path of template file
kubecluster.yaml was relative path. Due to which
magnum-conductor failed to start even if the file
exist. It was because os.path.isfile works with
absolute path only. Hence changing the default
value to absolute path.

Change-Id: I9acbd21cf178a1beee5df30389902577fefc6e48
Closes-bug: #1427069

3PAR now supports flash cache. Flash cache policy is set by the

Implements: blueprint 3par-flash-cache

commit_message:
Add flash cache policy to 3PAR driver

3PAR now supports flash cache. Flash cache policy is set by the
extra spec key "hp3par:flash_cache", with value being true or false.

This feature requires SSD disks and 3PAR firmware version 3.2.1 MU2
or greater.

Change-Id: I6d6fdab982ede3676289e587071520c798f4ce0f
Implements: blueprint 3par-flash-cache

revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2015-02-26 10:11:57.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/utils/__init__.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_utils.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_restriction.py'], 'message': "Mixin for checking restrictions in nailgun

Currently we haven't possibility to handle restrictions
and limits in nailgun. Validation logic declaratively
described in openstack.yaml so we need engine to process
it. Idea based on discussion in comments for
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/146235/. This commit

Change-Id: I76ea7aced08cd46d8ef240aa6c5976c317fdc7cb

commit_message:
Mixin for checking restrictions in nailgun

Currently we haven't possibility to handle restrictions
and limits in nailgun. Validation logic declaratively
described in openstack.yaml so we need engine to process
it. Idea based on discussion in comments for
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/146235/. This commit
provides simple interface for expression parser which
can check 'restrictions' section in YAML file.

Change-Id: I76ea7aced08cd46d8ef240aa6c5976c317fdc7cb

commit_message:
L2_patch resource for 'ovs' provider

'ovs' (for OVS-to-OVS and OVS-to-LNX cases):
* prefetch
* create patch
* remove patch
* remove unnided "vlan_ids" and "trunks" properties for patchcords
* store config for OVS-to-lnx patch

Blueprint: refactor-l23-linux-bridges
Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I4838e5625d8d36cd646dd228ac9f919a881e8f36

commit_message:
test_rbd doesn't run all test function

When running test_rbd with nosetests, almost
all RBDTestCase function not work. This is
because the decorator's inner function name
not start with 'test'.

Change-Id: I9acc9a304d074ae198d2ab70b936803b33677d02
Closes-Bug: #1415452

commit_message:
Ensure that 5.1.1 dependencies are installed

This commit adds a patching_classes class to ensure that Openstack
dependency packages managed by Puppet are upgraded during
the separate patching stage.
TODO: notifications for Openstack services based on given dependency
tags

Closes-Bug: 1392261

commit_message:
Use Neutron in Horizon integration tests job

Currently, gate-horizon-dsvm-integration job usee Nova Network
instead of Neutron.
Since the integration tests are also planned to test Neutron's
networking features within Horizon it only makes sense that Neutron
will be deployed.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Closes-Bug: #1425882

Change-Id: Ib4c4841521ea442b7430b9d24f45743bac491c7d

subject: Set default timeout value in rabbitmq-server ocf script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-22 07:37:42.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nova/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Set default timeout value in rabbitmq-server ocf script

It might be possible for the default timeout value to be
missing when the OCF script is called. In such case, the
script may terminate with leftover iptables rules blocking
the rabbit port 5673.

Making use of the occassion, remove the trailing whitespace.

Change-Id: I47c2b6c9cb38100d66602364cfd5e4be3a0d3ac5
Closes-Bug: 1404415
'}]
commit_message:
Set default timeout value in rabbitmq-server ocf script

It might be possible for the default timeout value to be
missing when the OCF script is called. In such case, the
script may terminate with leftover iptables rules blocking
the rabbit port 5673.

Making use of the occassion, remove the trailing whitespace.

Change-Id: I47c2b6c9cb38100d66602364cfd5e4be3a0d3ac5
Closes-Bug: 1404415

commit_message:
Implement a storage API

This patch adds a GET /v1/storage API to retrieve rated frames from the
cloudkitty database.

The goal is to be able to get already parsed and computed information
for reporting purpose (and possibly more).

Change-Id: I77f1dec49a73a37456e2df1fca1d9f2650fefb62

commit_message:

Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10257, 'name': 'Sridhar Gaddam', 'email': 'sgaddam@redhat.com', 'username': 'sridhargaddam'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-02-18 19:56:17.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/tests/test_netutils.py', 'oslo_utils/netutils.py'], 'message': 'Utility API to generate EUI-64 IPv6 address

For a network using IPv6 SLAAC, Neutron would calculate the port
addresses based on EUI-64 specification which is generated via
IPv6 prefix and the interface MAC address. EUI-64 is a standard
algorithm and is explained at the following url
http://packetlife.net/blog/2008/aug/4/eui-64-ipv6

This utility api is present in both Neutron [1] and Tempest [2] to
validate certain IPv6 scenarios. Hence, having it in oslo.utils
would be ideal.

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/common/ipv6_utils.py#L32
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/common/utils/data_utils.py#L85

Change-Id: I3d1c6b22ecddf7faad83cc12c674a9c5c96b1759
'}]
commit_message:
Utility API to generate EUI-64 IPv6 address

For a network using IPv6 SLAAC, Neutron would calculate the port
addresses based on EUI-64 specification which is generated via
IPv6 prefix and the interface MAC address. EUI-64 is a standard
algorithm and is explained at the following url
http://packetlife.net/blog/2008/aug/4/eui-64-ipv6

This utility api is present in both Neutron [1] and Tempest [2] to
validate certain IPv6 scenarios. Hence, having it in oslo.utils
would be ideal.

[1] - https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/common/ipv6_utils.py#L32
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/common/utils/data_utils.py#L85

Change-Id: I3d1c6b22ecddf7faad83cc12c674a9c5c96b1759

Mapping rules can specify that effective users should be local users

commit_message:
Authenticate local users via federated workflow

Mapping rules can specify that effective users should be local users
with all their roles. For that we need a way to distinguish which flow
should be choosen (user is either ``ephemeral`` or ``local``). This patch
correctly interprets mapped properties and sets authentication context
so either workflow goes as ephemeral or local user.
As part of the required work, class UserAuthInfo was moved from
``keystone/auth/plugins/password.py`` to
``keystone/auth/plugins/core.py`` and is now accessed after importing
``keystone.auth.plugins`` module.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I90b7408a9905aa96387414d9250b410b28eff485
Partially-Implements: bp federated-direct-user-mapping

 A swift_store_cacert option is added to the Description of
 swift configuration options table (glance_store section) in the
 Configuration Reference Guide. It allows Glance's services
 to perform SSL verification when communicating with Swift
 (using a string that gives the path to a CA certificate bundle file).
 All the Glance tables were automatically regenerated, and the

Change-Id: Ieea6c557e9d2a30db700c60c7628cc358b0f9e5a
Closes-Bug: #1421220
"}]
commit_message:
Adds swift_store_cacert option to config reference

 A swift_store_cacert option is added to the Description of
 swift configuration options table (glance_store section) in the
 Configuration Reference Guide. It allows Glance's services
 to perform SSL verification when communicating with Swift
 (using a string that gives the path to a CA certificate bundle file).
 All the Glance tables were automatically regenerated, and the
 ones with changes were added to the patch.

Change-Id: Ieea6c557e9d2a30db700c60c7628cc358b0f9e5a
Closes-Bug: #1421220

commit_message:
Move UserAuthInfo to a separate file

Since authentication plugins ``password.Password`` and ``mapped.Mapped`` need
use class UserAuthInfo, we need to move it out of the ``password`` module.
It is going to be moved to ``auth.plugins.core`` module, accessible via
importing ``keystone.auth.plugins`` module.

Change-Id: I4ec97eb0169881e6a50598f5b3a9d655378e2481
Partially-Implements: bp federated-direct-user-mapping

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-02-27 15:13:18.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/federation/utils.py'], 'message': "Make RuleProcessor._UserType class public

Since keystone.auth.plugins.mapped.Mapped auth plugin must be aware what
kind of user is being authorized (ephemeral or local) we need to make
class RuleProcessor._UserType public. This means the class is going to be
renamed to UserType and taken out of the RuleProcessor's namespace.

Change-Id: I9a3c64448432190fc818ecdc79c429c57e09e476
Partially-Implements: bp federated-direct-user-mapping
"}]
commit_message:
Make RuleProcessor._UserType class public

Since keystone.auth.plugins.mapped.Mapped auth plugin must be aware what
kind of user is being authorized (ephemeral or local) we need to make
class RuleProcessor._UserType public. This means the class is going to be
renamed to UserType and taken out of the RuleProcessor's namespace.

Change-Id: I9a3c64448432190fc818ecdc79c429c57e09e476
Partially-Implements: bp federated-direct-user-mapping

'}]
commit_message:
[Cloud Admin Guide] Fix net mismatch in OVS config example

In the multi-tenant example (Scenario 2) of Open vSwitch in OpenStack
Cloud Administrator Guide fix the 'neutron subnet-create' command
to refer to the network created for tenant B, "net02", rather than
the network created in the previous section for tenant A, "net01".

Change-Id: I4f3cca3163e0d85bd15b13ee5e46cbd44f0ef63e
Closes-Bug: #1426429

With advent of direct users mapping we need to treat users as objects,
not single identifiers (name, id). This patch introduces user

commit_message:
Enhance user identification in mapping engine

With advent of direct users mapping we need to treat users as objects,
not single identifiers (name, id). This patch introduces user
dictionaries filled as a result of assertion mapping.
The patch also introduces user type which is either ``local`` or
``ephemeral``.

Partially-Implements: bp federated-direct-user-mapping
Change-Id: I0a4d14daa3e1cb3572db65b1e91b0acc57c81234

commit_message:
Remove 'transfer-show' step in transfer accept

A 'Display the transfer request details by using the ID' step
has been removed because 'cinder transfer-show' returns
'Not Found' error when the volume recipient is not an admin user.

Change-Id: I524e103a356a91c02a94f43c96f2a1b0563bd148
Closes-Bug: #1424517

commit_message:
Password config options should be marked secret

If passwords are not marked secret, there is the potential for
them to be logged in a world readable location.

SecImpact

Change-Id: I3204d12622cf0e5684e7e9ecc5f3755031503d3a

subject: Remove prefix from centos-rdo-base when building image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 06:44:21.000000000', 'files': ['docker/centos-rdo-base/.buildconf'], 'message': 'Remove prefix from centos-rdo-base when building image

All base images should have a .buildconf that blanks the PREFIX variable
otherwise the buildscript prepends the prefix to its name, for example
centos-rdo-centos-rdo instead of simply centos-rdo.

Change-Id: I48209e708094ae28681a874bf12a0206c524b639
'}]
commit_message:
Remove prefix from centos-rdo-base when building image

All base images should have a .buildconf that blanks the PREFIX variable
otherwise the buildscript prepends the prefix to its name, for example
centos-rdo-centos-rdo instead of simply centos-rdo.

Change-Id: I48209e708094ae28681a874bf12a0206c524b639

Removed extra "nose" pre-req from tox.ini as it is already in
test-requirements.txt, and it causes a "double requirement"
error when running via tox.  Also fixed relative directory

commit_message:
Update functionaltests to be able to run tox -e functional

Removed extra "nose" pre-req from tox.ini as it is already in
test-requirements.txt, and it causes a "double requirement"
error when running via tox.  Also fixed relative directory
reference to ensure we pick up the right etc/functional_tests.conf
file.

Change-Id: Iffb2891012ff0a4bb13a34bd7f8784104453b150

subject: Correctly delete replica controller
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-02 02:09:30.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/conductor/handlers/common/kube_utils.py', 'doc/source/dev/dev-quickstart.rst', 'magnum/tests/conductor/handlers/test_kube.py', 'magnum/conductor/handlers/kube.py'], 'message': "Correctly delete replica controller

The correct way to delete a rc should be:
1. Resize the rc to 0.
2. Delete all pods in the rc.
3. Delete the rc.
So, we should use 'kubectl stop rc id' to completely delete a rc.
This command will first resize a rc to 0 and then delete all pods,
before deleting the rc.

Change-Id: I3666606f15440942c192aa81635899fa135d036d
Closes-Bug: 1424304
"}]
commit_message:
Correctly delete replica controller

The correct way to delete a rc should be:
1. Resize the rc to 0.
2. Delete all pods in the rc.
3. Delete the rc.
So, we should use 'kubectl stop rc id' to completely delete a rc.
This command will first resize a rc to 0 and then delete all pods,
before deleting the rc.

Change-Id: I3666606f15440942c192aa81635899fa135d036d
Closes-Bug: 1424304

subject: Remove warnings from openstack responses
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7155, 'name': 'Sebastien Badia', 'email': 'seb@sebian.fr', 'username': 'sbadia'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}, {'_account_id': 11166, 'name': 'Lukas Bezdicka', 'email': 'social@v3.sk', 'username': 'xbezdick'}, {'_account_id': 13294, 'name': 'Javier Peña', 'email': 'jpena@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpena'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-27 14:06:12.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/keystone_user/openstack_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb'], 'message': "Remove warnings from openstack responses

Puppet's `commands` and `has_command` methods are not able to separate
stdout and stderr. When the openstack command prints out unexpected
warnings that have no bearing on our computation, we need to ignore it,
otherwise the CSV module will fail to parse it. This patch filters the
total response produced by the openstack command into only lines that
match a CSV-like regular expression with at least two fields.

If a legitimate error is produced that causes the command to return
failure, puppet catches it during the command execution and raises a
Puppet::Execution error, so this change will not affect its ability to
detect legitimate failures and report on them.

Change-Id: I4f3a8b1ddf6b06dcbf194dd66408c71d4da6d861
"}]
commit_message:
Remove warnings from openstack responses

Puppet's `commands` and `has_command` methods are not able to separate
stdout and stderr. When the openstack command prints out unexpected
warnings that have no bearing on our computation, we need to ignore it,
otherwise the CSV module will fail to parse it. This patch filters the
total response produced by the openstack command into only lines that
match a CSV-like regular expression with at least two fields.

If a legitimate error is produced that causes the command to return
failure, puppet catches it during the command execution and raises a
Puppet::Execution error, so this change will not affect its ability to
detect legitimate failures and report on them.

Change-Id: I4f3a8b1ddf6b06dcbf194dd66408c71d4da6d861

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
puppet-lint plugins.  Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some
just catch common errors.

Change-Id: I6a4e08d91f8cc19eb1e59af03a2a7d14716ddc38

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-27 17:25:27.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/heat_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add support for identity_uri.

This patch adds the ability to set a new identity_uri parameter.
It also deprecates the old auth_host, auth_port, auth_protocol,
and auth_admin_prefix parameters. Logic is in place so that
users of the deprecated settings should have a smooth upgrade
process and get deprecation warnings until they adopt the
new settings.

Change-Id: I833bbac9338553daf88459a311f14a3788d90dfb
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for identity_uri.

This patch adds the ability to set a new identity_uri parameter.
It also deprecates the old auth_host, auth_port, auth_protocol,
and auth_admin_prefix parameters. Logic is in place so that
users of the deprecated settings should have a smooth upgrade
process and get deprecation warnings until they adopt the
new settings.

Change-Id: I833bbac9338553daf88459a311f14a3788d90dfb

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-02-27 15:46:27.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_validate.py', 'heat/engine/template.py', 'heat/engine/cfn/template.py', 'heat/tests/test_template.py', 'heat/engine/hot/template.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': "Add resource_definitions check to Stack.validate

We should check resource attributes' types in validate method
for preventing stack creation with incorrect resources. So
this patch splits resource_definitions() methods on
validate_resource_definitions() and resource_definitions()
methods and add validate_resource_definitions() to Stack.validate
method.

Change-Id: I16b35fc105154d9391f64285e90c396537fe3bb7
Partial-bug: #1397969"}]
commit_message:
Add resource_definitions check to Stack.validate

We should check resource attributes' types in validate method
for preventing stack creation with incorrect resources. So
this patch splits resource_definitions() methods on
validate_resource_definitions() and resource_definitions()
methods and add validate_resource_definitions() to Stack.validate
method.

Change-Id: I16b35fc105154d9391f64285e90c396537fe3bb7
Partial-bug: #1397969

subject: Change the engine-listener topic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-27 15:07:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack_lock.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Change the engine-listener topic

In oslo.messaging to identify a "rpc server" we have to set the
server attribut of the target. But currently, the engine-listener uses
the hostname of the host, that make all workers on the host to be
identified has same "rpc server" by oslo.messaging, by chance because
heat uses a different topics for each workers, that works.

This change uses the engine id instead of the hostname to identify the
"rpc server" and use the same topic for all engine listeners.

Related-bug: #1414674

Change-Id: I359709ab15ee24ac2459826264adf2373dbb067f
'}]
commit_message:
Change the engine-listener topic

In oslo.messaging to identify a "rpc server" we have to set the
server attribut of the target. But currently, the engine-listener uses
the hostname of the host, that make all workers on the host to be
identified has same "rpc server" by oslo.messaging, by chance because
heat uses a different topics for each workers, that works.

This change uses the engine id instead of the hostname to identify the
"rpc server" and use the same topic for all engine listeners.

Related-bug: #1414674

Change-Id: I359709ab15ee24ac2459826264adf2373dbb067f

commit_message:
Make cinderclient metadata CLI output consistent

cinder metadata-update-all and metadata-show produces
inconsistent output. The following patch makes the output of each
command above consistent, where each metadata property will
be printed on a separate table row.

Change-Id: I42933bc6c0e4f925c19cfd4db6d1a205de06a73d
Closes-Bug: #1366289

commit_message:
Use relative path for cfn-init

/opt/aws/bin is a non standard path, so just assume that cfn-init
is in PATH, which it always is, no matter how it is installed.

Change-Id: I9f261fa885da4b9747e7be204b19127f3aad2ecf

commit_message:
StackResource convert update_with_template to RPC

Convert the update path to RPC, so we can spread the load of doing
nested stack updates over multiple engines, note this currently
has some issues TODO due to bug #1360292 where the autoscaling
resource update logic is incompatible with the revised logic here,
as it doesn't poll the check_update_complete correctly.

Change-Id: Id46032fc73c7b2a8aab360cc6eeda44cc4efc037
blueprint: decouple-nested

of directly, so the load of suspending the stack and polling nova
can be spread over multiple engines

Modifies the delete path for nested stacks so we pass the delete
request via RPC, so the delete workload can potentially be spread
over multiple engines where you're deleting a large tree of nested
resources.

blueprint: decouple-nested
"}]
commit_message:
StackResource convert delete_nested to RPC

Modifies the delete path for nested stacks so we pass the delete
request via RPC, so the delete workload can potentially be spread
over multiple engines where you're deleting a large tree of nested
resources.

Change-Id: I3f413556be09b6d9183d3f2616faee4d856ea3f6
blueprint: decouple-nested

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-17 22:28:37.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/heat-template-decomposition.rst'], 'message': 'Decompose cluster template for Heat

Currently Sahara creates one large template with a lot of
copy-paste resources. Last Heat features like template
composition could help to move all composition work from Sahara
to Heat. This will also allow to have individual cluster parts
as separate templates and insert them as resources (in
comparison to current text manipulations).

Change-Id: I0e19fe107fde5c4a5e27e87494d59945074de05e
Blueprint: heat-template-decomposition
'}]
commit_message:
Decompose cluster template for Heat

Currently Sahara creates one large template with a lot of
copy-paste resources. Last Heat features like template
composition could help to move all composition work from Sahara
to Heat. This will also allow to have individual cluster parts
as separate templates and insert them as resources (in
comparison to current text manipulations).

Change-Id: I0e19fe107fde5c4a5e27e87494d59945074de05e
Blueprint: heat-template-decomposition

commit_message:
"repeat" function for HOT templates

This change adds a "repeat" function, which provides a loop control
structure that iterates over the items in a list replacing each item in
a template.

Change-Id: I4785d7f6f7ee84ddfee08789ca5fc86d54f8e23f
Implements: blueprint repeat-function

commit_message:
Changed documentation for datastore parameter for configuration-create

The datastore parameter for configuration-create is documented as
optional but is required if there is no default datastore. Changed
documentation to handle this case.

Closes-bug 1365702

Change-Id: I8d7869b77eeba8c5be510093d42ff6486f529b6d

commit_message:
Add submodule for service instance module

Add submodule called network_helper for service_instance module.
This network helper have all code from service instance connected with
network. For now there is only one network helper, which is working
connected with neutron. In the future there is a possibility to add another
helper which will work with nova network.

Partially implements bp split-service-instance

Change-Id: I65131a34b1d4178d021c70c172607b7d6a8f9804

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-01 07:30:26.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/contribute.rst'], 'message': 'Capture progress chart for vendor decomposition

This patch proposes a way to capture the current status of affairs
for the core/vendor decomposition to help developers and distributors
understand where the Neutron team is in the effort of implementing
the specification.

Initially this was being captured in a Google Doc, but it became
evident that it is best to keep this information as close to the code
as possible. This is very much a collective effort and everyone is
welcome to contribute to keeping this chart current and accurate. In
fact, patches targeting decomposition work will have to address this
table in the same context of the patch that affects the code being
decomposed.

This is not intended to be a documentation tool, or a user reference to
what is and is not a Neutron driver or plugin.

Partial-implements: blueprint core-vendor-decomposition

Change-Id: Ib9a5fa1c06edc837625d55f0ed71d814ee9f7913
'}]
commit_message:
Capture progress chart for vendor decomposition

This patch proposes a way to capture the current status of affairs
for the core/vendor decomposition to help developers and distributors
understand where the Neutron team is in the effort of implementing
the specification.

Initially this was being captured in a Google Doc, but it became
evident that it is best to keep this information as close to the code
as possible. This is very much a collective effort and everyone is
welcome to contribute to keeping this chart current and accurate. In
fact, patches targeting decomposition work will have to address this
table in the same context of the patch that affects the code being
decomposed.

This is not intended to be a documentation tool, or a user reference to
what is and is not a Neutron driver or plugin.

Partial-implements: blueprint core-vendor-decomposition

Change-Id: Ib9a5fa1c06edc837625d55f0ed71d814ee9f7913

subject: Do not use urllib3 vendorized
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-20 09:46:01.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/common/https.py', 'requirements.txt', 'glanceclient/common/http.py', 'tests/test_ssl.py'], 'message': "Do not use urllib3 vendorized

We now have urllib3 within the global-requirements. Therefore,
there is no reason why we should even attempt to use the
vendorized version of the requests package anymore. Using it
is dangerous, because it may lead to behavior which will be
different from the one when running on a distribution
(reminder: Debian has a de-vendorized version of requests).
To avoid any occurence of such bad thing, we should never
even do:
try:
    from requests.packages.urllib3 import X
except ImportError:
    from urllib3 import X

it should be always just from urllib3 import X, otherwise
the gate will behave differently than distributions.

This patch also adds urllib3 in glanceclient's reqs.

Change-Id: I0235cb6f9c4bfdae69b6bce03c78b3a0727c71b9
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use urllib3 vendorized

We now have urllib3 within the global-requirements. Therefore,
there is no reason why we should even attempt to use the
vendorized version of the requests package anymore. Using it
is dangerous, because it may lead to behavior which will be
different from the one when running on a distribution
(reminder: Debian has a de-vendorized version of requests).
To avoid any occurence of such bad thing, we should never
even do:
try:
    from requests.packages.urllib3 import X
except ImportError:
    from urllib3 import X

it should be always just from urllib3 import X, otherwise
the gate will behave differently than distributions.

This patch also adds urllib3 in glanceclient's reqs.

Change-Id: I0235cb6f9c4bfdae69b6bce03c78b3a0727c71b9

Error messages were being passed with either JSON or HTML formatting
leading to an unpleasant user experience. This strips the JSON or HTML
tags and presents the clean error message to the user.

Rewrote the lispy function to be more pythonic, added test cases
and cleaned up some pep8 violations.

Removed commented out cruft from a previous version of this
patch.

Added code to eliminate the duplicate detail messages from the list
and reordered the assertion string to match actual output.

Refactored duplicate elimination code to be more readable and
reliable.

Some reworking of the duplication elimination loop to make it

Change-Id: I79985b3e305cb30328a3c16b025315a8e969243d
Closes-Bug: 1398838

commit_message:
Strip json and html from error messages

Error messages were being passed with either JSON or HTML formatting
leading to an unpleasant user experience. This strips the JSON or HTML
tags and presents the clean error message to the user.

Rewrote the lispy function to be more pythonic, added test cases
and cleaned up some pep8 violations.

Removed commented out cruft from a previous version of this
patch.

Changed the HTML details from a set to a list in order to ensure
the ordering of the exception details.

Added code to eliminate the duplicate detail messages from the list
and reordered the assertion string to match actual output.

Refactored duplicate elimination code to be more readable and
reliable.

Some reworking of the duplication elimination loop to make it
more readable.

Removed unneeded conditional to filter out empty elements.

Change-Id: I79985b3e305cb30328a3c16b025315a8e969243d
Closes-Bug: 1398838

commit_message:
Fix coverage report

Coverage can't handle package names that have dashes, as it uses the
package name to look for the base module name. So we need to pass in the
base module name as it is imported.

Change-Id: I2840eea85acaee2d05cab47fb67010e002a14bc0

commit_message:
Allow keystone validation bypass for noauth usage

To enable the eventual use of the shade library for communication
with ironic in situations where authentication is set to noauth, it
is necessary to not attempt to validate a user's credentials.

Added a check to disable authentication validation when the
auth_plugin is set to '' or 'None' or None.

Change-Id: I3807b4724ce5e204b5857c1dbf5325f0e3f4a78d

commit_message:
Password config options should be marked secret

If passwords are not marked secret, there is the potential for
them to be logged in a world readable location.

Link to the OSSG guideline (may change in the future):
https://github.com/hyakuhei/OSSG-Security-Practices/blob/master/sensitive_config_file_options.md

Oslo.config descriptions:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.config/cfg.html#special-handling-instructions

SecImpact

Change-Id: I6d5c80b7610d593fdd331c726039f1456d2c5bf7

In Iedf0d4f829e46ca64c3f4fc6a7dfee54d9b0605b we added support for driver
capabilities in glance_store. That same change also used (mutable)
module globals to check driver capabilities. By moving the capability

Change-Id: I13c7bd507252e793b2c790cc9b77c7b8db432d02

commit_message:
Use a named enum for capability values

In Iedf0d4f829e46ca64c3f4fc6a7dfee54d9b0605b we added support for driver
capabilities in glance_store. That same change also used (mutable)
module globals to check driver capabilities. By moving the capability
definitions inside a subclass of IntEnum we retain all of the previous
functionality with the guarantee that the enum values will not change
once defined.

Change-Id: I13c7bd507252e793b2c790cc9b77c7b8db432d02

commit_message:
Removing alpha warning on distributed mode

Per the Sahara team meeting on 2015/02/26, distributed
mode should no longer be marked as an alpha feature as
of the Kilo release, as it is well covered by our test
suite and has been proven stable.

Change-Id: I6c2ff54d8b2fcba89d68a27030f14da11942a3f0
Closes-Bug: #1426512

Bring more compatibility with oslo_db

Prevent make request with empty filter (supress sqlalchemy warning).
Bonus: enable a test by fixing its lame name.

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-02-26 14:34:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Replication status periodic task optimization

A periodic task exists to update the replication status for all volumes.
Currently, this task executes for all drivers and always retrieves all
volumes for the current host from the DB.

This patch set:
* Ensures that the periodic task is only activated if the driver actually
  supports replication
* Only retrieves volumes from the DB if 'replication_status'!='disabled' in
  the periodic task

Also, the driver documentation in cinder.volume.driver.VolumeDriver.
get_volume_stats() is updated to reflect that the 'replication' key indicates
that the driver supports replication; this is the key that was actually
implemented in the drivers that support replication.

Change-Id: I61fbc31567ad0b6908a00113adeaccf415343e8e
Closes-Bug: 1383524
"}]
commit_message:
Replication status periodic task optimization

A periodic task exists to update the replication status for all volumes.
Currently, this task executes for all drivers and always retrieves all
volumes for the current host from the DB.

This patch set:
* Ensures that the periodic task is only activated if the driver actually
  supports replication
* Only retrieves volumes from the DB if 'replication_status'!='disabled' in
  the periodic task

Also, the driver documentation in cinder.volume.driver.VolumeDriver.
get_volume_stats() is updated to reflect that the 'replication' key indicates
that the driver supports replication; this is the key that was actually
implemented in the drivers that support replication.

Change-Id: I61fbc31567ad0b6908a00113adeaccf415343e8e
Closes-Bug: 1383524

subject: Pickup instance from log format record
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-03-01 00:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/formatters.py', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py'], 'message': 'Pickup instance from log format record

Nova has moved to oslo.log, however one specific usecase is
blowing up in Nova. when they use instance=instance in say
LOG.info to pass in instance, they expect the uuid in the
instance dict/object to be printed in the log. However we
end up with the string-ified version of the Instance object
or the entire instance dict which is not good.

Closes-Bug: #1426544
Change-Id: I2d1b09015bead2012327f973f45f3f6728160c69
'}]
commit_message:
Pickup instance from log format record

Nova has moved to oslo.log, however one specific usecase is
blowing up in Nova. when they use instance=instance in say
LOG.info to pass in instance, they expect the uuid in the
instance dict/object to be printed in the log. However we
end up with the string-ified version of the Instance object
or the entire instance dict which is not good.

Closes-Bug: #1426544
Change-Id: I2d1b09015bead2012327f973f45f3f6728160c69

This also removes a comment for a parameter that no longer exists,

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-04 06:30:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/volumes/tables.py'], 'message': 'Add "btn-create" Class to Create Volume Button

Create volume button doesn't have 'btn-create' class. So when
volume quota exceeded, and then delete volume, create volume
button will not come back to enabled automatically, because
that will not run the update action.

Closes-Bug: 1398577

Change-Id: I449b07b658f56979a03d350ea2ffaa4ec2879d09
'}]
commit_message:
Add "btn-create" Class to Create Volume Button

Create volume button doesn't have 'btn-create' class. So when
volume quota exceeded, and then delete volume, create volume
button will not come back to enabled automatically, because
that will not run the update action.

Closes-Bug: 1398577

Change-Id: I449b07b658f56979a03d350ea2ffaa4ec2879d09

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-27 22:17:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_process_monitor.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_keepalived.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/base.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_ovsdb_monitor.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/sanity/test_sanity.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': "Check whether sudo is enabled in BaseSudoTestCase.setUpClass

Currently functional test classes requiring invocation of commands via a
root helper inherit from BaseSudoTestCase[1] and should call explicitly
check_sudo_enabled in order to skip the test if sudo is disabled[2].

This change performs such check during BaseSudoTestCase.setUp in order
to ensure the check is done and replaces parent class for functional
test cases not requiring invocation of commands via a root helper.

This change prepares to transform BaseOVSLinuxTestCase[3] methods into
helper methods.

[1] in neutron.tests.functional.base
[2] sudo is enabled if OS_SUDO_TESTING is set to '1' or 'True'
[3] in neutron.tests.functional.agent.linux.base

Change-Id: I91a3506524352211729ac8b3b07cf3082fd8f13a
"}]
commit_message:
Check whether sudo is enabled in BaseSudoTestCase.setUpClass

Currently functional test classes requiring invocation of commands via a
root helper inherit from BaseSudoTestCase[1] and should call explicitly
check_sudo_enabled in order to skip the test if sudo is disabled[2].

This change performs such check during BaseSudoTestCase.setUp in order
to ensure the check is done and replaces parent class for functional
test cases not requiring invocation of commands via a root helper.

This change prepares to transform BaseOVSLinuxTestCase[3] methods into
helper methods.

[1] in neutron.tests.functional.base
[2] sudo is enabled if OS_SUDO_TESTING is set to '1' or 'True'
[3] in neutron.tests.functional.agent.linux.base

Change-Id: I91a3506524352211729ac8b3b07cf3082fd8f13a

subject: Remove single quotes from cliutils
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-27 12:37:07.000000000', 'files': ['rally/cmd/cliutils.py'], 'message': 'Remove single quotes from cliutils

PEP8 checker on rally CI gates is complying from time to
time about single quotes in rally.cliutils. Because of this
reason Jenkins check is failing very often.
Single quotes has been replaced with double quotes.

Change-Id: I9a3a3b31006cfe272e21b71d5442b627fa718c95
'}]
commit_message:
Remove single quotes from cliutils

PEP8 checker on rally CI gates is complying from time to
time about single quotes in rally.cliutils. Because of this
reason Jenkins check is failing very often.
Single quotes has been replaced with double quotes.

Change-Id: I9a3a3b31006cfe272e21b71d5442b627fa718c95

commit_message:
Add master flavor

Allow specification of master flavor. This allows choice of flavor for
the master node and the flavor size of the nodes that the containers
will run on. Often you will want a large flavor size for the nodes
running docker to load many containers, but a small flavor size for the
master just running control plane services for the docker nodes.

Change-Id: Id7691cde80ea403cfe38634958bb009a24e017dc
Partial-Bug: 1418713

revisions:
[{'number': 28, 'created': '2015-02-28 04:33:02.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/angular/charts/charts.js', 'horizon/static/angular/charts/chart-tooltip.js', 'horizon/static/angular/widget.module.js', 'horizon/static/angular/charts/pie-chart.html', 'horizon/templates/horizon/_scripts.html', 'horizon/test/jasmine/jasmine_tests.py', 'horizon/static/angular/charts/pie-chart.js', 'horizon/static/angular/charts/pie-chart.spec.js', 'horizon/static/angular/styles.scss', 'horizon/static/angular/charts/chart-tooltip.scss', 'horizon/static/angular/charts/pie-chart.scss', 'horizon/templates/horizon/jasmine/jasmine.html', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/_variables.scss', 'horizon/static/angular/charts/chart-tooltip.html'], 'message': 'Pie and donut chart directive

A reusable directive with customizable outer radius, inner radius,
label, and legend. Chart is updated on data change. Setting inner
radius to '0' will result in pie chart. Hovering over a slice will
show a tooltip.

This directive can be used to render quota charts in "Launch Instance"
workflow and related details panels.

Example Usage:
<pie-chart chart-data='instances'
           chart-settings='settings'></pie-chart>

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Change-Id: I24f1e94b68c87617177806cbfe4542876b0eec47
'}]
commit_message:
Pie and donut chart directive

A reusable directive with customizable outer radius, inner radius,
label, and legend. Chart is updated on data change. Setting inner
radius to '0' will result in pie chart. Hovering over a slice will
show a tooltip.

This directive can be used to render quota charts in "Launch Instance"
workflow and related details panels.

Example Usage:
<pie-chart chart-data='instances'
           chart-settings='settings'></pie-chart>

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Change-Id: I24f1e94b68c87617177806cbfe4542876b0eec47

subject: libvirt: Make sure volumes are well detected during block migration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8122, 'name': 'Cyril Roelandt', 'email': 'cyril@redhat.com', 'username': 'cyril.roelandt.enovance'}, {'_account_id': 8151, 'name': 'Michal Jura', 'email': 'mjura@suse.com', 'username': 'mjura'}, {'_account_id': 8213, 'name': 'Claudiu Belu', 'email': 'claudiu.belu@canonical.com', 'username': 'claudiub'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 18:46:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/virt/fake.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Make sure volumes are well detected during block migration

Current implementation of live migration in libvirt incorrectly includes
block devices on shared storage (e.g., NFS) when computing destination
storage requirements. Since these volumes are already on shared storage
they do not need to be migrated. As a result, migration fails if the
amount of free space on the shared drive is less than the size of the
volume to be migrated. The problem is addressed by adding a
block_device_info parameter to check_can_live_migrate_source() to allow
volumes to be filtered correctly when computing migration space
requirements.

This only fixes the issue on libvirt: it is unclear whether other
implementations suffer from the same issue.

Thanks to Florent Flament for spotting and fixing an issue while trying out
this patch.

Co-Authored-By: Florent Flament <florent.flament@cloudwatt.com>
Change-Id: Iac7d2cd2a70800fd89864463ca45c030c47411b0
Closes-Bug: #1356552
(cherry picked from commit 671aa9f8b7ca5274696f83bde0d4822ee431b837)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Make sure volumes are well detected during block migration

Current implementation of live migration in libvirt incorrectly includes
block devices on shared storage (e.g., NFS) when computing destination
storage requirements. Since these volumes are already on shared storage
they do not need to be migrated. As a result, migration fails if the
amount of free space on the shared drive is less than the size of the
volume to be migrated. The problem is addressed by adding a
block_device_info parameter to check_can_live_migrate_source() to allow
volumes to be filtered correctly when computing migration space
requirements.

This only fixes the issue on libvirt: it is unclear whether other
implementations suffer from the same issue.

Thanks to Florent Flament for spotting and fixing an issue while trying out
this patch.

Co-Authored-By: Florent Flament <florent.flament@cloudwatt.com>
Change-Id: Iac7d2cd2a70800fd89864463ca45c030c47411b0
Closes-Bug: #1356552
(cherry picked from commit 671aa9f8b7ca5274696f83bde0d4822ee431b837)

subject: Create log dir with sudo to avoid permission issue
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-27 21:47:25.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/redstack'], 'message': 'Create log dir with sudo to avoid permission issue

If you run 'redstack install' on a clean machine, it now fails with the
following error:

$ ./redstack install
mkdir: cannot create directory '/opt/stack': Permission denied

Running with 'set -vx' gives the following additional info:

run_command $@
+ run_command install
+ '[' 1 -lt 1 ']'
+ case "$1" in
+ cmd_install
+ mkdir -p /opt/stack/logs
mkdir: cannot create directory '/opt/stack': Permission denied

This bug was introduced by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158538/

This patchset changed the log dir to the OS standard (/opt/stack/logs).
Redstack tries to create the log dir if it doesn't exist and this
happens before devstack has had a chance to create the directory.
It can fail as the user typically does not have permission to create
the directory under /opt.

Using 'sudo' alleviates this.

Note: This only is an issue on new installs, as /opt/stack will already
exist on previous installs and be owned by the user.

Change-Id: I71ea8023b6b83c1ae46cac4f02766bb5e47d1a75
Closes-Bug: #1426551'}]
commit_message:
Create log dir with sudo to avoid permission issue

If you run 'redstack install' on a clean machine, it now fails with the
following error:

$ ./redstack install
mkdir: cannot create directory '/opt/stack': Permission denied

Running with 'set -vx' gives the following additional info:

run_command $@
+ run_command install
+ '[' 1 -lt 1 ']'
+ case "$1" in
+ cmd_install
+ mkdir -p /opt/stack/logs
mkdir: cannot create directory '/opt/stack': Permission denied

This bug was introduced by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158538/

This patchset changed the log dir to the OS standard (/opt/stack/logs).
Redstack tries to create the log dir if it doesn't exist and this
happens before devstack has had a chance to create the directory.
It can fail as the user typically does not have permission to create
the directory under /opt.

Using 'sudo' alleviates this.

Note: This only is an issue on new installs, as /opt/stack will already
exist on previous installs and be owned by the user.

Change-Id: I71ea8023b6b83c1ae46cac4f02766bb5e47d1a75
Closes-Bug: #1426551

commit_message:
Sync 'threadgroup' from oslo-incubator

The threadgroup module hasn't had a sync since September of 2014.
The module needs to be updated to support the move to using the
oslo_log library.  This patch brings us up to the latest module
level.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
---------------------
commit e589dde0721a0a67e4030813e582afec6e70d042
Date:  Wed Feb 18 03:08:12 2015 +0000
Merge "Have a little fun with release notes"

Changes merged with this patch:
---------------------
2fbf5065 - Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API
1523f000 - threadgroup: don't log GreenletExit

Change-Id: I5b7e281f6879f2749cd8b446c65e2fcb3abfbe95

commit_message:
Make del_fdb_flow() idempotent.

Addresses an issue where del_fdb_flow() gets a duplicate call for
the same port, which results in a KeyError. This change makes the
call more idempotent, so that it doesn't cause other follow-on
errors as a result of the uncaught exception.

Change-Id: I7a3a34dd654e143dee06c3e4642e859211a312ca
Closes-bug: #1421105
